The 7 Habits are universal principles for personal and interpersonal effectiveness and are integrated across all key learning programmes in the school.  Robotics is the school's Applied Learning Programme and opportunities are provided for pupils across all levels to use robotics as a fun and engaging way to solve problems_ think creatively and work together in teams to overcome challenges.  SOAR (Sports Opportunities for Active lifestyle and physical Resilience) is the school's Learning for Life Programme. It provides a platform for all pupils to apply the fundamental movement and skills they have learnt in Physical Education during sport events such as Sports Fiesta_ Track and Field Carnival and Character through Play. All pupils_ regardless of their abilities_ are encouraged to enjoy and experience success in sports.  The school has a vibrant Life Science Programme that includes Orchid Hybridization_ Aeroponics and gardens that invite pupils to discover and learn science in authentic contexts_ such as a butterfly enclosure_ edibles garden_ garden of character_ eco-garden and corridor gardens. We have also collaborated with Science Centre to produce various science learning kits that encourage pupils to adopt an active inquiry approach in investigating scientific concepts.

visionstatement_desc: Every Si Ling Pupil a Scholar who Leads and Serves
missionstatement_desc: We_ in partnership with all our stakeholders_ are committed to nurture our pupils to be thinking learners and gracious citizens.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our schools name in Chinese_ depicts a garden where scholars bloom. We strive to provide a unique and rigorous education to maximise the potential of each pupil_ so that each of them will become a scholar in their own right. Besides the cognitive domain_ the school embraces the arts_ music_ sports_ and other pursuits so that pupils can broaden their interests and develop their talents. The schools strength in environment education enables pupils to build critical thinking and problem solving skills_ at the same time develop an awareness and appreciation for the environment.  The school also places strong emphasis on values education_ as well as leadership development. We have developed comprehensive Values Education and Leadership Development Programmes which inculcate the values and competencies desired of our pupils_ so that they become concerned citizens who make a positive difference to the community.   With the nurturing leadership and guidance of our School Leaders and teachers_ the school is committed to develop every Si Ling pupil into a Scholar who leads and serves.
special_sdp_offered: Our Applied Learning Programme (ALP)_ Environmental Science Programme (ESP)_ provides pupils with opportunities to apply science knowledge_ processes and attitudes acquired from science lessons in real-life environmental issues_ allowing their learning to be relevant_ meaningful and enjoyable. Stakeholders are roped in to enhance pupils# learning experiences_ as well as provide opportunities for pupils to gain more exposure.  The ESP adopts the 3H approach which covers 3 key developmental domains # HEAD (knowledge & skills acquisition)_ HEART (values acquisition) and HANDS (participation & contribution). The programme aims to develop pupils to continuously use concepts_ skills and processes to inquire into phenomena related to the environment_ think creatively and critically in solving environmental problems_ and have strong conviction in bettering the environment. Pupils with greater aptitude and interest are given opportunities to lead their peers in community involvement activities_ as well as conduct sharing to create awareness on environment conservation. This is in line with the Schools Vision to develop every Si Ling Pupil into a Scholar who Leads and Serves.

visionstatement_desc: Thinkers. Learners. Leaders.
missionstatement_desc: To empower every child to realise his full potential through a values-driven holistic education.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Jing Shan Primary School has a long established history of more than 70 years and provides a quality holistic education with strong emphasis the five school values of Loyalty_ Integrity_ Generosity_ Enthusiasm_ Respect and Responsibility (LIGER) to prepare our pupils for the future. At Jing Shan_ we value each and every child and seek to provide a happy and conducive environment for our pupils to learn and grow.   Teachers have a lasting influence on the lives of the pupils we teach and we play a key role in nurturing our children as we lead_ care and inspire them to empower every child to realise his full potential through a values-driven holistic education.  We believe that Every Child Can Learn; Every Child is Unique; and Every Child is Different. These beliefs about how children can learn forms the basis of our school's Culture of Care_ Culture of Collaboration and Culture of Learning and enable us to develop our pupils to become "Thinkers. Learners. Leaders."
special_sdp_offered: Jing Shan Primary School is a caring school with an innovative and values-driven curriculum_ providing a value-added learning experience to nurture learners into thinking leaders. Our curriculum prepares pupils holistically in the moral_ intellectual_ physical_ social and aesthetic domains.  We have two signature programmes in Visual Arts & Pottery and Science.  Our Applied Learning Programme is distinguished through the I3 Approach (Inquiry_ ICT& Innovation)_ where thinking routines are infused with technology in the learning of Science.  Our Learning for Life Programme is in the area of Visual Arts & Pottery and promotes the learning of critical 21st century competencies through the use of artful thinking routines_ a Harvard University's Project Zero initiative_ in the in-house curriculum.        We place equal emphasis on character development through a comprehensive Pupil Leadership and Character and Citizenship Education Programme to develop our pupils into values-driven leaders.

visionstatement_desc: A Learning Organisation_ Nurturing Global Citizens
missionstatement_desc: Providing a holistic education to develop independent and engaged learners who are caring and confident citizens
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school believes in Student-Centric_ Values-Driven Education (SVE) and adopted SVE in the design of the school's programmes and articulation of the school's vision_ mission and values (INSPIRE - Integrity_ Nation-loving_ Sincerity_ Perseverance_ Independence_ Respect and Excellence).  School Culture The school's culture of care and learning is anchored on the Core Theory of Success. It is actively promoted through building quality relationships_ learning and development of staff_ and development of pupils in the CAMPSL (Cognitive_ Aesthetics_ Moral_ Physical_ Social and Student Leadership) domains. Values inculcation in Yishun Primary School (YPS) is structured and programmes such as Value of the Month Award and Garden of Values Wall engender the building of a positive psychosocial environment for learning. The inculcation of values in our students aims to develop individuals who are strong in character who will eventually be an asset to the society.   Striving for Excellence Over the years_ YPS has been recognised for excelling in both the curricular and co-curricular areas. The school continues to provide its pupils with a strong foundation in literacy and numeracy skills_ develop their love for learning and equip them with 21st Century Competencies and sound moral values to prepare them for life.    Staff and Teachers As Key Enablers  Every YPS graduate passes through the good and able hands of the school's teachers. The school continues to focus on developing its staff and teachers and building quality relationship with staff_ teachers and stakeholders. The school believes that the quality of its programmes and the positive school outcomes are attributed to the quality of its people and the collective effort of the whole school collaborating and synergising together.
special_sdp_offered: Learning for Life Programme (LLP): Viva De Symphonie - Championing Values: Living_ Learning & Growing Through Music Anchoring on the approaches of Music for All and Music for Excellence_ the school's LLP aims to develop pupil character through its 6-year progressive music programme. Pupils develop the joy of learning as they learn to play the various musical instruments. Young talents are systematically identified and developed through the school's music CCA groups. Opportunities are also given for them to be groomed at external platforms.   Applied Learning Programme (ALP): Environment Science The ALP aims to impart our pupils the practical concepts of science and its interplay with the environment through inquiry-based learning. Through the ALP_ pupils develop entrepreneurial dare as they are engaged in the hands-on activities of creating new plant species through orchid hybridisation and nepenthes cultivation. Pupils develop 21CC (eg. Critical and Inventive Thinking_ Communication_ Collaboration and Information skills) as they collaborate with one another during the learning process. Pupils with greater interests are given opportunities to participate in global environmental activities and competitions.   Cultivating the spirit of learning through Design Thinking in Project Work Project Work in the school is exciting and engaging as pupils immerse themselves in the Design Thinking process in solving real world issues. Coupled with VIA and ALP_ project work provides the platform for pupils to learn and apply their multi-disciplinary knowledge and skills.   PrAISE (Pre-Assembly Instruction For Student Engagement) and AR2ISE (All-Round Recess Instruction For Student Engagement) To develop all pupils holistically_ they are involved in the school's PrAISE and AR2ISE programmes. Through these programmes_ pupils are engaged in brain-based activities and game-based learning as an extension to the classroom instruction to develop their social-emotional and life skills.

visionstatement_desc: Stamfordians of Competence and Character_ who Care and Contribute
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing hearts and engaging minds_ enabling Stamfordians to realize their potential and live fully for self and others.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our school uphold the philosophy of Every Stamfordian Matters.
special_sdp_offered: School Distinctive Programme LLP: Character and Leadership through Sports and Outdoor Education   Special Student Development Programme E2K_ Talent Development Programme_ Globalisation Programme_ Public Speaking_ Speech and Drama Programme

bus_desc: Sengkang and Toa Payoh interchange - no 163_ Along Yio Chu Kang Road_ - no 70_ 86_ 103 and 854.
visionstatement_desc: Global Learners of Tomorrow - Confident Person    - Successful Learner - Involved Citizen
missionstatement_desc: A vibrant school that inspires all to maximize their potential_ instills in them a passion for learning and brings out in them a heart to serve.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We_ at Fernvale Primary School_ believe that Every Child Can Learn and Every Child is Unique.  Every Child Can Learn - Each child comes to our school with a different entry point. We identify the learning needs of each child and customize the curriculum to pace each child's learning in a safe environment_ conducive for learning. Our teachers guide each child's efforts by giving regular feedback_ emphasizing that effort directed at growth leads to success. Every child is engaged in his assessment_ setting his own learning targets and taking the responsibility to track_ reflect on and share his learning progress with peers.  Every Child is Unique - Each child has strengths and interests that are different from others. We recognize the abilities every child has in the area of Sports_ Art & Crafts and Music. Our teachers design a range of programmes in and out of the classroom_ nurturing the potential in Sports and Aesthetics in every child at the level the child can attain.  Our Defining Statement_ Caring Hearts_ Creative Minds_ Uniquely Fernvale_ characterizes our school.  Caring Hearts - We believe in fostering good relationships between staff and students. Every member of our staff_ from our security guards to our teachers_ nurtures a caring attitude towards our students. Our Student Development Team creates appropriate level-wide programmes to deepen the bonding between teachers and students.  Creative Minds - We promote a culture of innovation among our teachers_ working in collaborative teams to create programmes that enhance student learning.  Uniquely Fernvale - We do things differently in developing a Quality School Experience for our students. We encourage students of different cultures to participate in CCAs such as Dikir Barat_ Wushu_ Guzhen and Indian Dance_ for them to appreciate other cultures. Our Learning for Life Programme and Satellite Partnership with Fernvale Gardens School_ emphasizing a heart to serve_ also add to our uniqueness.
special_sdp_offered: Programmes that build the Confident Person Programme for Active Learning develops social emotional learning competencies in P1-P2 students through active participation in Sports_ Outdoor Education_ Speech & Drama and Visual & Performing Arts.   Morning Wellness Programme_ Play@Recess and Sports Club activities build students' fitness.   Art Talk for all focusses on understanding and appreciating different art forms.  Student Leadership_ a 3-tiered approach of Self_ Team and Thought Leadership targets 3 groups of students_ namely classroom leaders_ prefects & CCA leaders and prefects at EXCO respectively.   Camps at P5 and P6 build confidence_ resilience and teamwork in students and strong teacher-student bonding.  Programmes that develop the Successful Learner The Guided Reading programme for P1-P3 and P5-P6 Foundation students builds varied vocabulary. P4-P6 students use Socratic questioning to develop critical thinking skills_ reading the Little Red Dot. Read & Share@Fernvale cultivates a love for reading Mother Tongue books.   Mathematics trails for all to enhance thinking and problem solving skills.  Budding Scientist programme at P1- P2 builds curiosity in Science. Science Talk facilitates inquiry at P4-P6. P6 students conduct experiments and articulate Science concepts to their peers through Busking @Recess.  The use of ICT in Project Work_ classroom activities and learning journeys to develop skills in self-directed and collaborative learning in all students.  Programmes that grow the Involved Citizen Learning for Life Programme_ Greenova_ nurtures innovative and responsible environmentalists who care and advocate for the environment in school and the community. Our students recycle_ reduce food waste and innovate ways to conserve water.   We are on a Satellite Partnership with Fernvale Gardens School_ nurturing our students to socially interact and grow friendships with their SPED school buddies.

mrt_desc: Bishan MRT_ Ang Mo Kio MRT Stations
visionstatement_desc: Leaders of Character_ Learners for Life
missionstatement_desc: To nurture people of character_ healthy patriotic citizens and creative independent thinkers equipped with 21st century skills
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school believes in the holistic development of the child. Guided by our school vision "Leaders of Character_ Learners for Life"_ the school has five desired student outcomes for every Townsvillite growing students to be: a gracious pupil; a self-directed learner; a creative thinker; a responsible citizen; and a resilient leader.    Our school values_ the iCARe3 (Integrity our Foundation; Compassion our Key; Ardent for Singapore_ our Home; Respect_ Responsibility & Resilience_ our Strengths) are not only taught explicitly by teachers and incorporated in to our school programmes.  The school has a Culture of Care_ Collaboration & Excellence. Pupils put into practice the Care for Self_ Care for Others_ Care for School and Care for the Community. They are also exposed to different learning opportunities to develop and horn their skills to effectively collaborate with others to achieve excellence.
special_sdp_offered: The school has identified the Visual Arts_ our LLP_ as a platform to deliver a well-rounded education.  Through the visual arts_ students acquire not only art-making knowledge and skills but also develop 21st century competencies such as critical and inventive thinking skills. Our LLP also caters to the social-emotional growth of students by offering an avenue for life-long enjoyment and appreciation of artistic works and performances.  The processes of ideation_ conceptualization_ development_ refinement and appreciation of art_ coupled with the richness of different art genres_ also enables pupils to strengthen their understanding of national identity and foster an appreciation of their cultural heritage.   In Townsville Primary School_ we believe that every child can learn to lead. The school adopts The Leader in Townsville (LiT) programme_ based on Dr Stephen Convey's 7 Habits of Highly Effectively People_ to develop student leadership at different levels and equip pupils with skills to be a leader_ lead their school mates and contribute to their home_ the school and the community.  To build the joy of learning and promote life-long learning_ the school adopts the Experiential Learning Model_ which allows pupils to gain knowledge beyond what is being taught through the transformation of experience. Our pupils are given opportunities to experience_ apply and reflect on their learning. For example_ the Mobile Learning@TVPS provides an authentic learning environment in the Science Eco Garden. Students go through an interactive trail_ learning about the wonderful life of plants and animals through the use of ICT tools like iPads. They would then apply their knowledge to specific situations/experiments and reflect on their learning.

visionstatement_desc: Scholars of Tomorrow. Scholars refers to students equipped with the 21st Century Competencies; eventually grow to be people of integrity_ imbued with a sense of community spirit_ identity & responsibility as they take their places in our diverse society. Rulang envisions Tomorrow as a future that is full of uncertainties. Hence_ Rulang aims to equip students with the skills and environment to develop resilience and adaptability which would help them thrive. Rulang also aims to inspire students t
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Competencies_ Inspiring Excellence_ Empowering Individuals. In leading Rulangnites to be the Scholars of Tomorrow_ our mission is to equip them with the desired 21st Century Competencies. In embracing globalization_ students will be exposed to civic literacy_ global awareness and cross cultural skills with opportunities for them to hone their critical and inventive thinking. Rulang strives to inspire pupils in achieving excellence in the five domains namely cognitive_ aesthetics_ physi
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school philosophy encapsulates our belief that given the right environment and support_ all pupils can learn and achieve. Rulang aims to provide a holistic education that creates learning experiences to develop each pupil's intellectual capacities_ character_ aesthetics_ sporting and leadership qualities through an enriched forward-looking learning environment beyond the classroom. Rulang is also committed in creating school experiences that are pupils centric and would equip pupils with the necessary knowledge_ skills and values for living and working as active contributors in the 21st century. These areas include increasing resiliency in our students_ use of ICT to deepen pedagogy and the promotion of an Aesthetics Culture to harness our pupils' creativity and curiosity.    The Rulang family is bonded by the culture of excellence_ collegiality and teamwork. This culture and working ethics are based on the acronyms TRUE HEARTs where every staff is valued and every effort recognized and celebrated. The TRUE HEART culture spurs the staff towards quality staff work and school pride.   The TRUE HEARTs philosophy has also been cascaded to all Rulangnites. A Rulangnite is taught to never stop questioning_ encouraged to blaze his own trail instead of accepting barriers_ and to infuse the TRUE HEARTs culture and spirit into his everyday life. This will instill in Rulangnites the core leadership values of having integrity_ being morally upright_ and being a risk taker.   We believe that Rulangnites can achieve peaks of excellence by being the best that they can be in their chosen fields.  Upon completion of their primary education_ they will each graduate as an accomplished learner_ a loyal citizen_ an effective leader and a cosmopolitan.
special_sdp_offered: Rulang Primary School aims to provide a holistic education to develop all pupils into confident 21st Century learners and wholesome individuals.  Applied Learning Programme (ALP): Enhancing 21CC through Robotics challenges students to connect their existing schema and apply them to an authentic setting for acquisition of knowledge. Our Integrated Robotics Curriculum (IRC) lessons serve to bring about higher engagement in learning and cultivates teamwork through collaborative learning.   Learning for Life Programme (LLP): STRIVE @ Rulang (Sports Teach Responsibility_ Inventiveness_ Values & Excellence). This is a broad based programme for all students and is all-inclusive sporting and outdoor experience whilst providing opportunities for those with greater interest and/or talent to further develop their strengths and interests. We have a structured Physical Education programme that spans from P1 to P6 (modular system)_ Programme for Active Learning (PAL) which is targeted at P1 & P2 and a myriad of Co-Curricular Activities (CCAs) that are offered to the students at P3 to P6  through a skill_ aptitude and interest based approach are aligned with 21CC. Our unique and structured Character Development Framework and Student Leadership Framework seek to develop pupils into wholesome individuals through five domains namely socialisation_ citizenship_ leadership_ entrepreneurship and internationalisation. In imbuing identified values and outcomes_ the framework has been integrated into instructional and non-instructional programmes while being explicitly taught in our customised school wide programmes namely Co-Curricular & Special Programmes (CCSP)_ GIFTS (Generating Interactions for Total Socialisation)   and Values-in-Practice Programme (VIP).

visionstatement_desc: An Achieving School with a Caring Environment
missionstatement_desc: Developing a community of life-long learners_ leaders of character and socially responsible global citizens
philosophy_culture_ethos: Qifa Primary School_ previously known as Khee Fatt Study Institution  was set up in 1906 by the Char Yong (Dabu) Association.  The school commemorated its 30th anniversary as a government school in 2015_ and 110 years as a Hakka school started by the Char Yong (Dabu) Association in 2016. As a government school_ Qifa continues to enjoy a good and unique relationship with its founding organisation.   Qifa is a choice school in the Clementi/West Coast neighbourhood_ with the school conducting balloting in the P1 Registration Exercise since 2010.  Over the years_ the school has garnered many accolades_ and it is recognised by its stakeholders for its rigorous academic programmes_ stellar Aesthetics and Co-curricular outcomes as well as a range of non-academic programmes that cater to the all-round development of its pupils.  These achievements are made possible by a team of dedicated and forward-looking staff together with the support of parents_ ex-students and the School Advisory Committee.  Through delivering a quality_ holistic and value-added education that recognises and develops pupils of diverse abilities and talents_ the school seeks to realise its vision to be "an achieving school with a caring environment".
special_sdp_offered: Applied Learning Programme - Effective Communication  The school aims to develop every Qifa pupil into a confident person who communicates effectively_ in line with MOE's 21st Century skills and student outcomes. The Effective Communication curriculum includes modules in speech_ drama and theatre_ master persuasive and argumentative techniques_ and leverages ICT tools and its Communication Arts Studio.  Platforms and opportunities are provided to a select group of talents to demonstrate and hone their skills through drama_ debates and public speaking competitions.   Learning for Life (LLP) Programme - CHAracter Moulding Programme through Sports (CHAMPS@Qifa)  Volleyball has always been a prominent sport with a strong tradition in Qifa. The school rides on its niche in Volleyball to broaden its impact through CHAMPS @Qifa. It seeks to equip all Qifa pupils with important life-skills and values such as teamwork_ perseverance_ sportsmanship_ and care for one another. It provides first-hand opportunity for pupils to exemplify the school values represented in 'ASPIRE': A Caring Heart_ Self-discipline & Integrity_ Pride in Work_ Inquiring Mind and Healthy Body_ Resilience and Enterprising Spirit.  Talent Development Programme The school nurtures its high progress pupils through the Talent Development Programme (TDP).  TDP is a customised curriculum with stimulating pedagogical approaches and authentic learning experiences.  The Active Thinking @Qifa Programme seeks to equip the pupils with MOE's 21st Century Competencies and Skills and Desired Student Outcomes as well as elements of Design Thinking with a focus on developing empathy.  The 'Values Education through Philosophy for Children (P4C) @Qifa' curriculum provides opportunities for the pupils to question values often established as norms_ and internalise ideas and values in a community of learners.

visionstatement_desc: Learning School GIVER3S Heart
missionstatement_desc: To nurture thinking individuals and gracious citizens
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school's vision of 'A Learning School with a GIVER3S Heart' is progressively realized through the strategic thrusts of Nurturing Self-directed and confident learners_ Developing Exemplary Character & Active Citizenry_ Building Quality Staff and Forging Partnerships. They guide the school in its commitment towards the creation of school experiences that are memorable_ enriching and inspiring.   This is in line with the school's mission 'To nurture thinking individuals and gracious citizens' and we are anchored and guided by the school GIVER3S values of: Graciousness_ Integrity_ Versatility_ Empathy_ Responsibility_ Respect_ Resilience and Sincerity.   The school also builds on a culture of care and collaboration for staff.
special_sdp_offered: The school believes in the holistic development of the whole child.  Our school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP) - Developing Zhangde GIVER3S Values Through Environment Education aims to instil in our students a love and concern for the environment through the inculcation of our GIVER3S values. The school has developed its own distinctive Environment Education curriculum that provides students with platforms to learn and explore the importance of conserving natural resources. Through these platforms_ our school aims to develop future generations of thinking individuals and gracious citizens who take accountability for their own actions and be responsible towards the environment_ a key 21st CC competency.   Our P3 - P5 Level Camps are part of the school's structured camp_ leadership training and CCE programme. It is aligned with the school's PE & Sports and Outdoor Education Framework and aim to provide our students a holistic education.   The learning experiences for the camps are aligned with our school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP) on 'Developing Zhangde GIVER3S Values Through Environment Education. The learning experiences at the camps aim to educate our students to care for their environment and the world we live in. The camp objectives also ties in with the CCE learning outcomes_ where students develop self-awareness and self-management skills to achieve personal well-being and effectiveness. Students also develop social-awareness and interpersonal skills to build and maintain positive relationships.   Values-in-Action (VIA) are learning experiences that support students' development as socially responsible citizens who contribute meaningfully to the community_ through the learning and application of values_ knowledge and skills. VIA fosters student ownership over how they contribute to the community. As part of VIA_ students reflect on their experiences_ the values they have put into practice_ and how they can continue to contribute meaningfully.

bus_desc: 8_ 10_ 17_18_ 27_ 31_ 65_ 292_ 293_ or any bus going into Tampines Interchange
first_vp_name: MDM LEE LAY SEE/ MRS LAY SEE NEUFELD
visionstatement_desc: An Icon of Excellence: To Value and be Valued
missionstatement_desc: To nurture life long learners of good character
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school philosophy is Every Pupil Can Learn and Excel. We believe that each pupil through his effort with the strong collaboration of home and school will be able to learn and in time to come have personal mastery.    The school culture is one of Innovation_ Care and Excellence. (ICE)  The school subscribes to the Core Theory of Success that quality relationships lead to quality action and quality results.The school values Learning_ Relationship and the Individual.  As a community school it aspires to be a blessing and a contribution to the community.
special_sdp_offered: *Bi-Cultural Programme aims to deepen pupils' proficiency in the language through exposure to Chinese Literature.  *Play@Work is the integration of Science in lower primary English lessons aims to spark interest and curiosity of Science phenomenon in the pupils.  *Scientist@Work - With Scientific inquiry as our main pedagogy_ Science is taught using the 5E Instructional model.Strategies like role-playing_ problem solving_ investigating and cooperative learning are employed.The importance of ethics of a Young Scientist are impressed on the pupils. *Senior & Junior Olympics provides pupils authentic opportunities to demonstrate and develop character aligned with the spirit of Olympism. Pupils apply skills and attitudes learnt through the year as they participate in inter class competitions.  *STAR ACTtituDE ( Strengths_ Talents_ Aspiration and Resilience to achieve A Character Turnaround and Transformation inspired through Drama in Education) is the school's  Learning for Life Programme. Through creative play and stimulation of the imagination_pupils will graduate with confidence in creating_ performing and responding. *TPS Spring seeks to inculcate life skills in pupils through an awareness of the environment and the community that we live in. The activities are customised for the different levels. *A set of rubrics with clear expectations_ in alignment with school values and the hallmark of a Tampinesian is provided for pupils self- assessment and to support parents' endorsement in recognising the child's progress in character development. *LaSER is a specialised_ customised Primary 1 literacy intervention programme initiated by the school to address literacy skills of P1 pupils who scored poorly in the national School Readiness Test_ but are not identified for the Learning Support Programme (LSP). *School-based Dyslexia Remediation (SDR) Programme is a structured_ multi-sensory and explicit teaching evidence-based strategy to equip pupils with Dyslexia.

first_vp_name: MR MOHAMAD NOOR BIN ABDUL MANAF @
visionstatement_desc: An Innovative Thinker  A Gracious Leader  An Engaged Citizen
missionstatement_desc: To nurture the leader in everyone with a heart to give and a mind to grow.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Inspired by the starfish story_ the school has chosen starfish to be its school mascot. Underpinning this is the school's guiding pinciple of Every Child Matters_ Every Staff Matters. The Chongzheng family is committed to making a positive difference in the lives of our students_ while ensuring the professional development and well-being of our staff_ so as to develop the CZ Star in every child.
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme is innovation and enterprise which is called EPIC - Empowering Pupils to Innovate for Community.  The tagline for this programme is Fun Ideas Serious Solutions. Through the school-based innovation curriculum_ all P1-P6 students are progressively taught critical thinking_ creative thinking_ problem-solving and decision-making skills through Project Work. To enable the students to authentically apply their learning_ the school integrates Project Work with Values-in-Action (VIA) programme. For our students who are inclined towards innovation_ the school has established an Innovation Club to provide intensive training and exposure to competitions to hone their innovation skills. Students create products and embark on projects that help solve community issues.  In providing holistic education_ the school conducts modular programmes for Music and Art. The students are also exposed to Environment Education through structured programmes that are organised throughout the year. With the setting up of Solar eHaven_ an open garden-like learning deck on sustainable energy_ Environment Education is integrated into the Science curriculum. There are various stations where pupils have hands-on activities to learn about energy conversion.

visionstatement_desc: An Innovative School of Discerning Learners and Caring Leaders
missionstatement_desc: We will provide Quality Teaching and Learning so that our pupils are rooted in values and stretched in their potential.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Xinghua Primary School is committed to growing pupils to be caring and also passionate about learning. We are committed to providing diverse learning opportunities which challenge students and yet offer happy learning moments. Our programmes_ guided by sound processes_ allow pupils opportunities to learn through new experiences.  Through a culture of care and innovation_ our pupils are immersed in an environment that equips them with the 21st Century Competencies.
special_sdp_offered: The Learning for Life Programme (LLP) in Xinghua Primary School centres on "Confidence Building and Critical thinking through the Visual Arts". The school believes that this focus is one of the key strategies to enhance the actualization of the school vision. Through participation in visual arts_ pupils' creativity and curiosity to learn can be unlocked_ helping them to grow a passion for learning.  Increased pupil participation in visual arts programmes will lead to more visible and tangible vibrancy as the physical presence of artworks and pupil activities throughout the school create the atmosphere. As the pupils discover more about the cultures of other races through the respective art forms and the artworks of local artists_ they develop a deeper understanding of Singapore's ethnic diversity and a sense of national identity. This nurtures the pupils into sensitive and caring citizens. Not only does active participation in visual art cultivate the school values_ the programme is able to promote critical thinking and communication skills among the pupils to become confident learners of the 21st century.

first_vp_name: MR ANDY MICKEY CHOONG TEK CHOY
visionstatement_desc: Global Learners_ Discerning Citizens
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Hearts and Minds
philosophy_culture_ethos: At Jiemin Primary School we aim to equip our students with the 21st century competencies and to build a strong foundation in the Languages_ Mathematics and Science.  We are committed to create a supportive_ engaging_ safe and inclusive environment with the support of parents and the community.
special_sdp_offered: Our Journalists in Making_ an Applied Learning Programme_ aims to develop our students in critical thinking_ oral and written communication skills and build their confidence to speak and write on any chosen topic at the class_ school or community level. Presentations during recess and at school events are platforms to build students' confidence. Students who would like to learn more about journalism can participate in the Journalists' Club where they learn more about being a journalist through workshops and platforms like reporting real-time news during school events.  Through our Learning for Life Programme_ Aesthetics Alive_ students learn to draw_ play instruments_ compose songs and appreciate music and art through our structured Art and Music Curricula. Students are also provided the opportunities to experiment with different musical instruments and dances during recesses. Students who have a flair for dancing and music can also participate in our Performing Arts CCAs such as  Modern Jazz Dance and Angklung Ensemble where more specific skills are taught and students also develop team spirit and leadership qualities.   To help students make informed choices_ P4 to P6 students make use of the ECG portal to find out more about themselves and the type of secondary schools that would be suitable for them. P6 students attend a one-day immersion programme at selected secondary schools to provide students with the opportunity to experience secondary school life and better understand about the secondary school curriculum. Career talks and talks by former students are some platforms where our students could find out more about secondary school life and the careers that they are interested in.

visionstatement_desc: A Concerned Leader_ A LifeLong Learner
missionstatement_desc: To nurture a community of passionate learners who are leaders with sound character_ in partnership with stakeholders
philosophy_culture_ethos: With a history of over 30 years_ Fuchun Primary School is located in the heart of Woodlands. As encapsulated in its vision and mission_ the school believes that every pupil is a confident leader who positively influences others through the demonstration of the school values - Respect_ Care_ Perseverance_ Responsibility and Integrity and embraces social and cultural diversities. The school also believes that each pupil is a learner who is constantly reflective_ actively sharing_ continuously learning and possesses the ability to aesthetically respond.   The school believes in the inculcation of values and life skills mastery as these skills are essential for the pupils to face future challenges in the globalised world. As such_ the teaching of values is integral to the school's curriculum and co-curriculum programmes. Pupils who have displayed the school values consistently will be affirmed through the presentation of the Fuchun Values Award in each term. Bi-monthly assembly talks are carried out to reiterate the importance of values in building character.    The school believes that the quality of teaching and learning depends on its teachers. Hence_ as part of professional development_ teachers are actively engaged in discussion to question their assumptions_ share subject expertise and teaching strategies to better engage the learners. The school is also proud of its strong culture of care among the staff.  Through the empowerment by the school leaders and the inclusive environment provided in the school_ this culture of care is further strengthened and passed on to the pupils. Under the positive influence of their teachers who show concern_ pupils demonstrate the value of care through their thoughts_ words and deeds.
special_sdp_offered: In alignment to its school's vision_ 'A Concerned Leader_ A Lifelong Learner'_ the school seeks to create a learning community to help our pupils excel holistically with a key focus to develop its pupils aesthetically. A comprehensive school-wide programme and achievements in the Performing Arts led the school to be recognised as a MOE Learning for Life Programme (LLP) School in Music Education and Performing Arts_ and the N7 Cluster Centre of Learning in Music. Pupils are given many opportunities to perform in front of an audience through the termly music competitions or exhibit their artworks publicly. They are groomed to become confident performers to showcase their talents at various platforms such as class competitions and Art Jam sessions during recess.  The Fuchun Home Skills Programme is a signature programme in the CCE curriculum. This programme comprises lessons on basic cooking and sewing skills which are pitched according to the pupils' readiness_ motor skills and interests. Through this programme_ pupils learn to be independent and self-reliant. The seamless integration of English_ Math and Science in the Home Skills Programme provides pupils with opportunities to experience authentic learning beyond the classroom. Pupils are able to revisit or learn concepts through hands-on activities.  The school believes that every pupil has the capability to lead by positively influencing oneself and others through his or her thoughts_ words and actions. Every pupil is given the chance to take up a leadership role in the school's bid to develop concerned leaders. The school developed a two-tiered leadership development framework which consists of cohort and locus leadership development. The former focuses on the development of personal leadership skills in every pupil while the latter develops specific leadership skills for student leaders to hone.  With these programmes_ the school strives to nurture concerned leaders_ and lifelong learners in every of its pupils.

visionstatement_desc: Self-directed Learners . Confident Leaders . Caring Citizens
missionstatement_desc: We are committed to providing a learner-centric and values-driven education.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Guided by our philosophy that 'Every child can learn and achieve'_ the school strives to provide every child with a broad-based education with opportunities for the development of talents. The student-centred philosophy rests on the premise that every child has the innate ability to acquire knowledge and skills and is thereby able to grow and develop when supported by a safe and nurturing environment conducive for learning.   The school believes in providing a caring and positive school culture for all_ whereby every individual enjoys learning and embracing the school motto_ striving 'Towards Excellence'. Anchored on values with a focus on student-centricity_ our staff are committed to nurturing our students to help them embody the Desired Outcomes of Education (DOEs) in being a confident person_ a self-directed learner_ an active contributor and a concerned citizen.     The school believes the importance of partnership with key stakeholders for the holistic development of our students. We seek to build quality relationships with our key stakeholders based on trust and mutual benefits to benefit our students.
special_sdp_offered: In alignment to the aspiration for our students_ our programmes will focus on the holistic education of Bukit Viewians. In particular_ our niche programmes - (1) 'Nurturing Values and Character through Aesthetics' programme which serves to nurture confidence and resilience in our students through the arts_ and to develop their social awareness and management; and (2) 'Developing Thinkers_ Collaborators & Communicators' Programme' which aims to equip students with critical and inventive thinking skills and dispositions.

visionstatement_desc: Every Cedarian a Lifelong Learner_ a Person of Character
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Enthusiastic Learners and Responsible Citizens
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school aspires to groom every Cedarian into individuals with robust character_ rooted in values. Every Cedarian also understands that learning never stops. Each of them loves learning and will pursue continuous learning throughout his/her life. We are committed to developing Cedarians into individuals who take ownership of their learning and participate actively in lessons.   Our CEDAR Values: - Courtesy   - Care  - Enthusiasm                                               - Determination   - Adaptability   - Responsibility
special_sdp_offered: Talent Management Our talent management model aims to identify_ develop and hone the academic and non-academic talents of our students. In so doing_ the school strives to help them build confidence and cultivate a drive to succeed.  Effective Communicators We aim to develop Cedarians who are able to think independently and critically_ and communicate effectively. Our in-house Effective Communication curriculum aims to develop students' ability to communicate effectively both in writing and speaking_ and to exercise sound reasoning_ decision-making and metacognition.  Creative Thinkers Our Applied Learning Programme_ Creative and Inventive Thinking_ is a 6-year programme where we aim to develop our students' learning attitude and thinking skills while honing their capacity for higher-order thinking and equipping them with a problem-solving mind-set. Students who demonstrated interest and aptitude are invited to join our Future Innovators' Programme where they are given opportunities to further enhance their thinking skills at platforms beyond the school.  Upstanding Leaders Our student leaders are called "Upstanding Leaders"- "upstanding" because they metaphorically and literally stand up for and advocate what is right; "leaders" because we believe that with training_ all our students are able to awaken and realise their leadership potential. We aim to strengthen the moral fibre in our students by teaching them not only to be model students but also to be role models for others in both word and action.  Active Contributors The various platforms in CCE and students' programmes aim to equip students with the abilities and skills to contribute positively to school initiatives such as VIA_ Environmental Education and Student Suggestion Scheme. Through these initiatives_ we hope to strengthen the students' social awareness by increasing their knowledge of community issues_ strengths and resources which will help them to develop understanding of the wider community.

visionstatement_desc: We Learn_ We Grow_ We Achieve
missionstatement_desc: Grow Leaders Empower Learners Mould Character
philosophy_culture_ethos: Through the school's vision_ OEPS aims to create a positive learning environment and to provide meaningful learning experiences that nurture the child to be a caring and confident lifelong learner who strives for his/her best. The school believes that every child deserves the opportunity to learn and to grow as good role models_ and to serve and to contribute back to the school and the society.  Building on the strong Culture of Care and focus on Character Development_ the school strives to strengthen its total curriculum through multiple structured learning platforms that allow students to practise 21st Century Competencies so that they can be self-directed and stay resilient in their pursuit for both academic and non-academic excellence. For example_ the strengthening of the school's student leadership programme is intended to provide leadership experience for all students in VIA service-learning projects so that they can internalize the importance of serving and contributing to the society.   The school strongly believes that nurturing the staff competencies and building effective partnerships with stakeholders are key drivers behind the delivery of total curriculum.   The school believes that a Good OEPS Teacher exhibits competencies in three key areas namely_ as Collaborative Learners_ Designers of Lessons and Reflective Practitioners. These are essential qualities to build positive teacher-student relationship and meeting the present and future needs of the students. The school also acknowledges that the Opera Parents Club (OPC) is a vital link to promote home-school partnerships. By leveraging on OPC's support and expertise_ the school is able to offer students richer learning experiences such as International Friendship Day and Career Day.
special_sdp_offered: The school has structured key programmes to strengthen its delivery of holistic education and building 21st Century Competencies: a) The 'Ignite De Arts' programme aims to promote a deeper appreciation of the Arts in all students. The comprehensive 6-year programme infuses values education in four key domains: Learn Arts_ Explore Arts_ Collaborative Arts and Fun Arts. Through these meaningfully planned experiences_ the students are able to see_ think_ hear and wonder_ and in turn self-discover their potential and talents in Arts. b) Student Leadership (Learn to Lead_ Lead to Serve): The school has set up a school-wide multi-tier structure to provide leadership development opportunities for all students. Leadership trainings are customized at class level and for upper primary students. They apply the leadership skills in their role as P5 buddy to new P1 students. Students who show greater aptitude are identified and further developed via additional leadership training and workshops to sharpen their leadership competencies.  With such skills set_ they will be able to initiate action amongst peers to make a difference and improve the lives of others. With a greater ownership of the learning experiences_ they will find the learning even more meaningful and likely be motivated to want to make a difference to the community. c) Character Education: The school sustains its positive school culture by adopting two school-wide approaches: Firstly_ 'Learn Through Play' is a school-based programme anchored on the school's belief that students learn best during play and students are guided by trained staff to manage their emotions and actions when interacting with others. Secondly_ the school adopts Restorative Practices to guide students to reflect on their actions and consequences so that they take responsibility for their actions and learn to care for others. Through these key approaches_ the school has enhanced the social well-being of the students.

visionstatement_desc: Inspiring Learners_ Edifying Leaders
missionstatement_desc: To nurture our pupils to be future-ready by providing a Total Education in RVPS
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our vision "Inspiring Learners_ Edifying Leaders" commits every RVian to work towards striving for the best outcomes for themselves and people around them. As Inspiring Learners_ RVians have the passion for continuous learning_ seek better ways of doing things and become committed members of the school as a learning organization. As Edifying Leaders_ RVians have the confidence and leadership qualities to inspire_ enrich and nurture the lives of others. We are committed to imbue our staff and pupils with this spirit of inspiring and edifying for us to contribute to the progress of our school and nation.  Our Philosophy 1.We believe that every child wants to and can learn_ develop and lead. 2.We believe that education is never just about knowledge and skills. Importantly_ it should also be about character and values. 3.We believe education must nurture creativity and curiosity in all children. 4.We believe education must empower all children to be critical in their thinking. 5.We believe that learning takes place in safe and caring environment_ & when children construct knowledge actively and collaboratively.  Our Core Values 1.Serve with Respect -We value people_ reaching out to build strong & trusting relationships. 2.Lead with Integrity -We demonstrate honesty & moral courage_ being upright & trustworthy. 3.Live with Compassion -We seek to understand & care_ extending our hands to others in need. 4.Learn with Excellence -We inspire learning_ seek continuous improvement & bring out the best in everyone.  Our Motto Strive for the Best  Our Culture RVPS is committed to building a school culture of Excellence through Joy in our work & Synergy amongst our staff. 1. Excellence -We pursue excellence in empowering staff capacity & enhancing student learning & achievements. 2. Joy -We experience joy as we inspire learning in our students & edify school colleagues. 3. Synergy -We enhance staff synergy with respect_ integrity & compassion so as to contribute to excellence.
special_sdp_offered: 1. Learning for Life Programme (LLP) - 'RVPS Leadership Development for a VUCA World'   We believe that what students can do with what they know is more important than what they know. Our school mission "To nurture our pupils to be Future-Ready by providing a Total Education in RVPS" gives a strong indication of our endeavour. Our school has put in place a holistic education experience strategic plan which encompasses core academic programme and programmes which are geared towards character_ citizenship_ life skills and leadership development. We believe that our Total Education will nurture our students to become "Inspiring Learners_ Edifying Leaders"_ and realise the desired outcomes of education.   A key underpin of our LLP is the school's philosophy "Every child can Learn and Lead". Aligned to this belief_ we have ensured that a student-centric_ values driven education with varied and holistic learning opportunities is provided for all our pupils. Strategic plans and programmes to develop and nurture students in their leadership as well as their active participation in community involvement projects have been created and enhanced over the years.  All these endeavours are undertaken to ensure that all RVians will grow up to be confident individuals_ who take initiatives for their learning_ and contribute actively as citizens of our country with compassion and integrity. Our LLP's key areas of focus are: a) Values Education through Character Citizen Education (CCE) b) Values in Action (VIA) through Community Involvement c) Leadership Development through Experiential Learning in Camps d) Edifying Leaders through Leadership Development Programmes  2. Other Student Development Programmes - P5 China Immersion Programmes - P3-P5 Camps - Learning Support Programmes (including SDR & RRP) - P3 Swimsafer Programme - Talent Development Programmes - Niche in Uniformed Groups (Scouts_ Brownies_ Red Cross)

visionstatement_desc: A Caring School That Strives For Excellence
missionstatement_desc: To Nurture Our Students to Become Values-Centred Individuals and Lifelong Learners
philosophy_culture_ethos: Anchored on our philosophy of being 'Committed to Providing an All-round Education in a Caring Environment Aimed at Bringing Out the Best in Each and Every Child'_ and our belief that 'Character is the Foundation'_ the school's distinctiveness lies in our emphasis on character development. Being recognised as the East Zone Centre of Excellence for Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) is a testament of this.   In line with the above_ the school promotes a culture of care and excellence as articulated in the school's vision of 'A Caring School that Strives for Excellence'. This is done through the adoption of school values of respect_ care_ harmony_ resilience_ responsibility and integrity - Respect_ care and harmony to create a culture of care and resilience; responsibility and integrity to build a culture of excellence. The school values form the basis on which good attitudes and behaviours are cultivated.  The school also encourages a growth mindset and continually pushes for improvements and innovation as part of our pursuit of excellence.  Emphasis on well-being and growth of staff and students is part of our caring school culture.  We nurture a caring culture by putting our students first and providing for their socio-emotional needs_ and through multiple platforms that involve the curricular_ co-curricular and positive relationship building efforts.    In promoting excellence amongst pupils_ recognition is given to those who demonstrate good values as well as those who strive for excellence and improvements. Recognition is done via platforms such as 'Catch Them Doing Right'_ the 'Roll of Honour' (ROH) programme_ highlighting of good behaviour at assemblies_ academic awards_ as well as the Edusave Character Award (ECHA). The ROH programme recognises students  who are exemplary in the display of the six school values_ and the ROH Board highlights those who have been exemplary in role-modelling the 'Value for the Month'.
special_sdp_offered: To develop students holistically and build their strength of character_ the school has a Learning for Life Programme_ 'Character Education through Team Sports'.  Skills such as goal-setting_ decision-making_ communication and problem-solving are taught through team sports such as basketball and soccer. Students also develop their fitness while learning to manage self in a group setting through fun games_ and exercise different strategies to overcome challenges encountered in a game situation. In addition_ the school has a myriad of CCAs to cater to the different interests and talents of our students so that they go on to lead healthy and active lifestyles.   The school has embarked on a Coding programme for the Upper Primary students to build their logical and creative thinking skills. By sequencing codes to activate a robot or play a game_ students acquire various problem-solving skills that they need in order to thrive in an ever-changing world. Beyond the cognitive aspects_ they would also learn to work collaboratively and be creators of technology. The use of ICT in a constructivist environment is part of the school's effort to make learning purposeful and joyful.  To make learning authentic and to expose our students to learning beyond the classroom_ we have learning journeys to Kidzania_ Art Museum_ the Esplanade and Sungei Buloh_ among others. We also have local and overseas cultural immersion trips so that students are able to develop their cross-cultural communication skills. Structured Art (digital art_ pottery_ batik painting) and Music (beatboxing_ Asian Percussion_ Ukelele) programmes  are conducted for the students aimed at growing students' knowledge and appreciation for the Arts.

second_vp_name: MR ABDUL MUTALIB B MOHAMMED AMIN
visionstatement_desc: A Champion in Every Child
missionstatement_desc: Build Character_ Challenge Minds_ Enrich Lives
philosophy_culture_ethos: After 6 years of education at Yumin Primary School_ we want our students to attain a champion mindset - with the 'wings and roots' for 21st century learning and living. We have articulated 3 Student Outcomes in line with MOE DOE and 21st CC_ which we believe will prepare our Champions with the knowledge_ skills and values necessary for the future:  - Confident & Effective Communicators - Critical & Creative Thinkers - Caring & Gracious Citizens  The school endeavours to provide a holistic and balanced education for all our students.  Students graduating from Yumin Primary are developed in the 5 domains of student development i.e. Cognitive_ Social & Moral_ Morale_ Aesthetics & Physical_ Leadership & Innovation domains.  We aim to systematically equip our students with the 21st Century competencies and develop into  a confident person_ a self-directed learner_ a concerned citizen and an active contributor.  This is the shared aspiration and responsibility of all staff.   The School Beliefs We believe  - all students want to learn and can learn_ though they may learn differently. - having high expectations of all our students_ providing them with opportunities and support are the foundations for progress. - teachers make a difference. - quality teaching contributes to good student discipline (in learning and behaviour)_ and that good discipline contributes to quality teaching and learning. - in teamwork and collaboration. - a holistic education best prepares our students for the future.  The School Motto: We Aspire_ We Strive_ We Achieve_ We Serve     We Aspire to be the Best we can Be     We Strive with Integrity & Perseverance to Achieve our Goals     We Serve with Respect and Compassion
special_sdp_offered: The school has two distinctive programmes outside the core curriculum to provide all students with more varied and authentic learning opportunities:   1. Project ACTIVAtE is a structured programme designed to facilitate a progressive values based learning process that involves students applying knowledge & skills to real life situations based on themes and concepts. It incorporates Values-in-Action which is an important component in our Character and Citizenship education that harnesses pupils' sense of ownership_ teamwork & proactivity in self-initiating purposeful projects that will make a difference to others.  The highlight of this programme is the incorporation of a design thinking protocol which allows the pupils to go through in-depth inquiry_ engage in a rigorous process of asking questions and utilize relevant resources to meet the needs of the beneficiaries.  This programme strives to develop our pupils to have a deep sense care and belonging to the community.  2. I3QUEST aims to develop critical & creative thinking skills through progressive and developmental programme focused on computational thinking and the use of creative computing tools.  Pupils acquire the skills of logic_ sequencing and create projects through the use of programming & coding tool kits.  In this learning process_ pupils are developed in 21st century competencies_ problems solving skills & facilitated collaborative learning.    Another key programme in the school is the Integrated Outdoor Learning Experience programme whereby subject integration is structured across Primary 1 to 6. It is anchored by the English curriculum and integrated with other subjects across the 6 levels. The pupils are actively engaged in posing questions_ being curious & constructing meaning throughout the learning experience. A key facet of this outdoor learning is the authentic experiential learning across subject disciplines supported by exciting ICT applications.

visionstatement_desc: Confident and resilient_ creative and thinking pupils who strive to succeed
missionstatement_desc: Believing and Nurturing - We believe in every child and we nurture our children so that they leave us holding their heads high and knowing that their future is in their hands.
philosophy_culture_ethos: In line with our mission of "Believing and Nurturing"_ we believe that every child has the potential and can learn_ even though each child may come with different starting points.  Hence_ the school strives to cater to the students' diverse needs; from "stretching" the high progress learners to providing the scaffolding support for the low progress learners.  At the end of their primary education_ we want all GESPians to be able to progress and access the many pathways open to them.
special_sdp_offered: To develop 21 CC competencies in our GESPians and prepare them for life-long learning_ the school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP) places emphasis on the acquisition of values and life skills focusing on music and the performing arts. The LLP provides students with different intensity of learning engagement according to their levels. In the cognitive domain_ varied learning activities are planned_ ranging from the Math Olympiad and Code for Fun for the high progress learners to motivational programmes and additional support in-and after-school for low progress learners. In PAL_ P1 and P2 students are exposed to various modules_ such as  Visual Arts and Outdoor Education modules. They are designed to be experiential_ enjoyable and encompass learning in a creative way; incorporating values and social and emotional learning. These PAL activities have also been scaled up to benefit the P3 and P4 students. Students with potential are identified and encouraged to join the related CCAs. Opportunities are also created to allow them to engage in informal/formal performances to build their confidence and showcase their talents.     In line with the national movement to keep Singapore clean and engender a sense of ownership and loyalty to school and nation_ we have partnered with NEA to raise students' environmental awareness and engage them in the routinised cleaning of their classrooms and surrounding areas. Learning journeys (local/overseas) are organised for students to experience different cultures and lifestyles and in the process_ appreciate Singapore better. Opportunities are also created with external partners to give students the opportunities to practise what they have learned through the school VIA programme. We will continue to strive to create a nurturing environment where GESPians who pass through our hands are developed into "Confident and Resilient_ Creative and Thinking Pupils who Strive to Succeed".

visionstatement_desc: A healthy_ confident_ gracious and morally upright pupil with a passion for learning and love for Singapore.
missionstatement_desc: To provide a safe and happy environment for our pupils to strive towards excellence.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Gongshang Primary School is a school with a rich tradition and illustrious history. Founded in 1920_ the school had its humble beginnings as a night school_ known as The Chinese Industrial and Commercial Continuation School which catered to the needs of the young migrants from China_ incorporating vocational training into its basic curriculum. Gongshang Primary has continued with the rich traditions of its history_ emphasizing a strong Asian tradition and culture.   We believe that every child can thrive in a safe and nurturing environment to become confident_ gracious and morally upright pupils who will be able to contribute to society with a sense of purpose and able to meet the challenges of the future. The broad-based and value-added curriculum emphasising on the holistic development of every child is specially tailored to ignite his or her passion and stretch the abilities and talents whilst anchored on the school's core values of Respect_ Integrity_ Perseverance and Thrift.   Teachers will continue to be at the forefront of pedagogical innovations_ harnessing technology and working in close partnership with our key partners_ the School Advisory Committee (SAC)_ Parent Support Group (PSG)_ the School Alumni as well as other parents to nurture every child to help him or her realise his or her full potential.
special_sdp_offered: At Gongshang Primary_ we are committed to providing all students with a holistic education through our student-centric holistic curriculum. The school's Instructional Programmes are customised to cater to the needs of our students through a myriad of student-centred approaches and diverse learning experiences focusing on development of the 21st Century competencies. We are committed to providing our students an education in which academic learning is well-balanced with character building and co-curricular activities. The school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP)_ Character Through Sports_ is drawn up based on a 6-year progressive programme outcome.  It provides all pupils with authentic learning experiences to hone their social emotional competencies to demonstrate the core values of responsibility_ integrity_ care_ resilience_ teamwork and harmony. This is done through 3 domains of learning_ namely cognitive_ affective and psychomotor. Through experiential and authentic learning_ both local and overseas_ these domains will be nurtured through the 3 main thrusts_ that is_ Sports & Games_ Outdoor Education and Leadership to ensure pervasiveness and porosity. Anchored on the Character Through Sports Framework_ the focus is based on a tiered approach_ that is_ catering to the entire cohort at lower primary (Primary 1 and 2)_ level specific customised approach at Primary 2 and 3_ culminating to specialised and focused training for identified students at Primary 4 to 6. Customised programmes such as the cohort level camps at Primary 4 and Primary 6_ Values-In-Action programmes and cross cultural experiences  reinforce the learning through providing opportunities for students to step out of their comfort zone to challenge themselves to be creative thinkers who are independent_ resilient_ respectful and are able to work collaboratively  in teams.

visionstatement_desc: Caring Thinkers; Adventurous Learners; Passionate Contributors.
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Hearts; Enriching Minds; Inspiring Growth
philosophy_culture_ethos: School Philosophy Every child has intrinsic worth; Every child can and wants to learn;  Every child can contribute as a gracious and responsible citizen of the world.   Bringing Out the Best in Every Child Every Student an Engaged Learner - We seek to foster the joy of learning and provide quality holistic education where students enjoy learning_ are motivated to pursue their interests and go on to fulfil their full potential.  Every Teacher a Caring Educator - Teachers lead_ care and inspire by word and deed_ through the care we give.   Every Parent a Supportive Partner - Parents complement the good work of our teachers and bring encouragement_ inspiration and wisdom to the child's learning journey.   Engaging Community as Partners - Harnessing supportive partners in creating opportunities for every student to learn for mastery_ learn throughout life and learn purposefully and meaningfully.  School Values - H.E.A.R.T Healthy Lifestyle Everyone is Special A love for Learning Responsible and Respectful Teamwork is Our Culture  Culture of Excellence and Learning  The culture of excellence fosters the attitude of doing our best and looking for ways to improve and do better. It is helping one another be the best that we can be. This is align to the school's motto of Aspire to Excel.  The culture of learning encourages the school to develop as a learning organisation that seeks to foster a culture of continuous questioning and refreshing of what we know_ and the organisational practice of helping every individual_ staff and students_ to develop throughout life.
special_sdp_offered: 1)LLP Visual Arts (LLP VA) As part of the Visual Arts (VA) Curriculum_ the C.A.P.s (Creative Arts Programme) provides the opportunity for all students to experience a comprehensive range of visual arts proficiencies. These include Ceramics_ Print Making_ Clay Tile Relief_ Sculpture and Art Appreciation. Integrated project work in the VA Curriculum engages students in their arts learning experiences_ through collaboration and active learning. These projects help our students to deepen their learning and allow them to make meaningful connections between the various subjects_ such as recycling in Science_ culture and values in CCE and digital art in ICT. Through these projects_ students embrace diversity_ become more aware of the environmental issues_ and better understand the various cultures.  2)LLP NurTuring Caring Thinkers_ Adventurous Learners and Passionate Contributors (LLP T-CAPs) @Huamin through Community Service & Student Leadership Development in Education for Sustainable Development (ESD). HMPS is the first UNESCO Associated Schools Project Network_ or ASPnet School in Singapore. The school's focus is on ESD_ namely in the domains of Culture and Environment. It encompasses the school's efforts in developing 21CC_ encouraging the arts and culture_ as well as in promoting and keeping the environment clean and green. The focus on Community Service and Student Leadership will thus support and strengthen our efforts towards ESD.  3)Project Work HMPS students apply the protocols of Design Thinking to work on a particular design challenge. In the process_ they build on 21CC such as effective communication and collaboration_ as well as internalise values_ mindsets and behaviours of a design thinker whilst acquiring relevant and new knowledge to solve real-world problems. Engaging in the Design Thinking process to address an issue they encounter also helps develop empathy for others and hence ignite the desire to contribute to the betterment of the community.

visionstatement_desc: Every Xishanite_ A Lifelong Learner_ A Contributing Citizen
missionstatement_desc: To create opportunities where passions are ignited_ potentials discovered and dreams realised.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our school philosophy that Every Child is important and Every Child Can Learn guides all staff to recognise that every child has his unique strengths and capabilities. We strive to know and grow our pupils to discover their individual  strengths and develop them to reach their fullest potential within a supportive environment.     In line with our Mission_ we seek to create opportunities to bring out the best in every child  through varied learning programmes and experiences. Anchored on a strong professional ethos_ our teachers build up every child in a caring and nurturing environment with high expectations for our pupils' holistic development_ so that every child grows to be a life-long learner and contributing citizen. We seek to build an inviting school where all our pupils appreciate a quality school experience_ exhibit the joy of learning and embrace the school values of Self-discipline_ Integrity_ Resilience and Respect.    The school prides itself in living out a strong community spirit_ in line with our motto of "Love_ Care_ Share" following that of our school founding pioneers_ through our active community involvement.
special_sdp_offered: The school believes that academic learning and character building are equally important in developing the whole child.     Our Learning for Life Programme (LLP)_ Empowerment through Sports Education_ aims to equip every pupil with mental skills that will shape a positive mindset and be guided by positive habits of mind to demonstrate good values and strong character.  Delivered via our Xishan's Physical Education curriculum and Sports & Games modules_ and integrated into the school's total curriculum_ pupils' acquisition and practice of mental skills will be manifested through changing attitudes_ mindsets and habits_ thereby shaping their disposition and build their competencies to meet varied situations that they might encounter in life.      Environmental education is a strong tenet in the school to promote a strong sense of community responsibility_ values inculcation and resource conservation.

visionstatement_desc: Every Child an Engaged Learner_ a Caring Citizen and a Steadfast Leader
missionstatement_desc: Together_ We Nurture and Inspire an Inclusive Spirit.
philosophy_culture_ethos: School Philosophy: Every One Can Learn_ Love and Lead  School Culture: The School embraces a Culture of Care_ Innovation and Discipline_ where discipline is unpacked as having the 'Disciplined People_ Disciplined Thoughts_ and Disciplined Actions'.
special_sdp_offered: Excellence in Character Development At Princess Elizabeth Primary School_ students are at the heart of our efforts in developing their character. These efforts have been affirmed by the Ministry of Education which awarded us with the Outstanding Development Award (Character Development) and designated our school as the West Zone Centre of Excellence for Character Development (WZ COE for CD).   As the WZ COE for CD_ PEPS serves as an anchor school in the West Zone to leverage on and develop their niche_ culture and excellence in CD. This includes the development of teachers through sharing best practices in Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) workshops_ customised programmes and sharing of CCE resources for teaching of core values and Social and Emotional (SE) competencies. These authentic resources are created by our own teachers and students. We also provide platform to nurture student leaders in primary schools in West Zone through workshop or camp to support the development of student leadership.   Learning for Life Programme (LLP) ASPIRE to Serve and Lead In alignment with our school vision _ 'Every Child_ an Engaged Learner_ a Caring Citizen and a Steadfast Leader_ the focus of our LLP would be on imbuing our students with our school's core values of Ambition_ Self-discipline_ Perseverance_ Integrity_ Respect and Empathy (ASPIRE). This is achieved through community service and tiered student leadership development via our Values In Action (VIA) programme. The ultimate aim is to lay a solid foundation for our students to appreciate the value of citizen leadership in caring for others within the community.

visionstatement_desc: Achievers rooted in values_ soaring beyond limits
missionstatement_desc: To nurture and inspire pupils to be self-directed learners_ gracious and resilient_ serving beyond self
philosophy_culture_ethos: Dazhong Primary School (DZPS) has a long history of almost 80 years. Anchored on our firm belief that every child can learn and give of one's best_ we strive to groom every student to serve beyond oneself and faces challenges with resilience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     A student-centric approach is adopted in designing our holistic curriculum to help every student live out our school's values of 'IREAP': 'Integrity_ Responsibility_ Excellence_ Acceptance and Perseverance'. Our six-year structured curriculum through our LLP-Arts Education programme offers a myriad of learning experiences which help to cultivate in every student_ 'Howard Gardner's 5 Minds for The Future' - The Disciplinary Mind_ The Synthesizing Mind_ The Creating Mind_ The Respectful Mind & The Ethical Mind'.  This prepares them to be self-directed learners_ gracious and resilient citizens who seek to serve beyond self for the future.                                                                                                                                                                                       Coupled with a warm and caring environment afforded by a team of committed staff_ we believe that our students can become 'Achievers rooted in values_ soaring beyond limits'.
special_sdp_offered: Learning for Life Programme (LLP):  Developing 21st century competencies through Arts Education Programme@Dazhong (AEP@DZPS). Our signature programme aims to develop our students to be future ready. We are also the only primary school in Singapore to have a Junior Orchestra Talent development programme supported by the MOE Arts Education Branch.  Character & Citizenship Development:  Resilience@DZPS via Outdoor Education Programme (OEP) aims to build resilience and 'gritty' children through a longitudinal OEP_ where students undergo rugged and authentic learning experiences to develop character_ strength and tenacity. Other Character Development programmes include 'myCEED@DZPS - Character and Citizenship Programme_ NE Current Buzz_ Gratitude Journalling & Servant Leadership Development Programme through iLEAD (Leadership Experience at Dazhong).  Cognitive (Critical & Inventive Thinking Development):  Beyond supporting the students' development in Literacy and Numeracy. Students are exposed to other stretch programmes such as Fun with Coding Programme to develop Computational Thinking Skills_ Science Learning through the  I- Experience programme_ Literacy programmes such as Writing With Purpose & the Math Mastery Programme.

mrt_desc: Bedok MRT Station_ Tanah Merah MRT Station
first_vp_name: MDM SHARIFAH FAIRUZ BTE S Y A
visionstatement_desc: Empowered Learners_ Persons of Strength and Character
