Inventory on the demonstration of FISH! Philosophy and school values beyond school. Some of the parents also inspired our students through the "Our Aspiration" programme where they shared about the knowledge_ skills and values that are vital towards achieving their goals in building their career.   In a child's educational journey_ the partnership between school and home cannot be undermined. At PGPS_ we recognize the need to constantly engage the parents to work in tandem with them to develop the child to his/her maximum potentials. To provide parents with a fuller picture of their child's holistic development_ the school conducts termly tripartite Parent-Teacher-Child Conferences where the students get to demonstrate their learning in various subject areas and share their reflections with their parents and teachers. This allows parents to see and hear from their child_ first-hand_ what he/she has learnt throughout the semester_ providing parents with an all-rounded view of the child's academic and character development. Such student-centric sessions allow the child to assume a more active role in his/her learning.

second_vp_name: MDM SHARIFAH SAMIRAH BTE SYED MOHAMAD
visionstatement_desc: Confident Learners_ Active Citizens After 6 years in Punggol View_ we want our students to become confident learenrs and active citizens.   A Confident Learner is  -Cognitively robust  -Aesthetically aware -Physically active  An Active Citizen is  -Morally upright -Emotionally adept -Socially responsible  We want our students to strive to "Do the Right Thing" and"Give of their Best" for future learning_ employment and citizenship.
missionstatement_desc: Touching Lives_ Inspiring Future To nurture the whole child through a values-based_holistic education in a caring and rich learning environment so that our students will become persons of character who are good and useful citizens of tomorrow.  We want to provide strong fundamentals for Future Learning that includes: - Nurturing sound values and social-emotional skills to develop character. - Develop the love for Singapore for active citizenry.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We adopt the Starfish Story as our philosophy to guide us to make a difference in the lives of our students_ staff and stakeholders.  Our motto "Grow and Glow" is an aspiration that as the school grows_ it will glow in the community as a school of distinction.    We believe in nurturing the whole child by guiding our students to develop their moral_ emotional_ social_ cognitive_ aesthetic and physical (MESCAP) domains to the fullest so that they will become persons of character who are good and useful citizens of tomorrow.  We want our students to:    - Learn the subject disciplines comprising the Languages_ Social Studies_ the Arts and Physical Education_ Mathematics and Science so as to build a strong foundation in literacy_ numeracy_ scientific and life skills for the future_   - Inculcate and cultivate values and social-emotional skills to develop moral character_   - Foster the emerging 21st Century Competencies so as to develop performance character_ and   - Enrich our students' learning experiences especially in the areas of creativity_ outdoor education_ student leadership and talent development so as to meet their diverse needs and interests_ and to realise their full potential.  We believe that we can do so by building a culture of care and learning in the school.  We provide a caring climate for our students to grow through positive teacher-student relationship and restorative practice to manage good behaviour and peer relationship.  We design a rigorous and sound school-based curriculum to foster the joy of learning and the drive for lifelong learning.  To further develop our students' talent and interest_ our students are provided opportunities to experience the following key programmes_ namely_ creativity and play-based learning_ outdoor education_ and student life and leadership programme.  We will need to: (1) enhance our staff capacity and well-being and (2) collaborate with the home and community to bring out the best in every student.
special_sdp_offered: Living Out our Values Every day (LOVE@PGVP) We believe that values are caught and not just taught. The school values are taught during our Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) Lessons and reinforced through our school-based programmes.  Students are taught to reflect on their actions on a Value Card and teachers will endorse the card upon the successful completion of the observable behaviours or actions. The students could be rewarded with a value badge. We hope by so doing_ our students will live out these values as habits for life  Learning for Life Programme - Outdoor Education   We believe firmly that Outdoor Education (OE) is a good opportunity to develop ruggedness and resilience in our students. Hence_ the school has put in place a comprehensive Learning for Life Programme (LLP) on Outdoor Education. This allows students to work in teams and collaborate with their peers to build character_ evoke their curiosity about nature_ and develop a feeling of wanting to protect the environment via Values in Action. In the process_ our students will learn to navigate_ assess risks and make decisions about their own safety and wellbeing_ while enjoying the outdoors.  These are essential life skills and values that we hope to develop in our students.   Creative LEGO Our signature Creative LEGO ensures that our students acquire the learning outcomes of Confidence_ Curiosity and Collaboration through a series of art-related experiences such as PAL. Students will acquire an appreciation for sculpture building as well as develop skills in aesthetics and creativity.  Through generating ideas creatively in groups and responding to issues and challenges_ our students would develop 21st century competencies such as collaboration and communicating effectively.  Most importantly_ our students will enjoy the learning through active engagement with the element of fun.

bus_desc: Sengkang and Toa Payoh interchange - no 163_ Along Yio Chu Kang Road_ - no 70_ 86_ 103 and 854.Punggol Temp Interchange to Bishan Interchange - Bus 50
visionstatement_desc: Vibrant School Culture of Care Spirit of Excellence
missionstatement_desc: To nurture healthy and happy individuals with strength of character_ ready to serve_ ready for the future.
philosophy_culture_ethos: na
special_sdp_offered: Speech & Drama

mrt_desc: Sengkang Station (NE16)  Nearest LRT station: Farmway  *10-15 min walk from either station
bus_desc: 50_ 85_ 102_ 372    Nearest Bus Stop: In front of Blk 326 Car Park  *1-2 min walk from bus stop; enter by Main Gate along Anchorvale Link or Rear Gate
visionstatement_desc: Every Springdalite is a Secure Individual_ a Leader of Self-worth and a Significant Citizen.
missionstatement_desc: To engage young minds_ mould their character and equip them for the future.
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school is guided by its education philosophy of Play.Passion.Purpose (3Ps). This is anchored on the belief that the learning process is equally_ if not more important_ than the learning content itself.  Every child is encouraged to explore and discover new knowledge through experiential and authentic learning (Play) so that he or she can discover the joy of learning. It is hoped that in doing so_ the child will develop the drive to deepen his or her mastery (Passion) and eventually to harness that for the betterment of the community and society (Purpose).   This education philosophy is undergirded by the school's emphasis on character building. Time is set aside to ensure that values are explicitly and systematically transmitted through age appropriate activities to all students.   The school seeks to develop a strong and cohesive culture premised on the GREAT ethos of Growth_ Radiance_ Empathy_ Abundance and Truth. All staff serve as role models for the students and guide them in embracing and displaying the R3ICH values of Respect_ Responsibility_ Resilience_ Integrity_ Care & Harmony.
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP) is Out-of-Door Education (ODE) which seeks to provide an integrated learning experience through creative installations within the school such as the Low-elements Rope Trail_ Science Eco-garden Trail and the Learning Maze. In addition_ it also provides authentic learning experiences for the students by tapping on learning spaces both within and beyond the school. For instance_ learning journeys in this school are specially designed by the teachers to enable inquiry learning. The school also trains the students to adopt an innovative and solution-focused mindset through the use of Design Thinking as a problem-solving protocol.   Another signature offering of the school is the I Can! Programme which is specially designed for its Primary 1 and 2 students to develop their skills and competence in self-management_ confidence in social interaction and use of information and communication technology (ICT). Some of the skills covered include packing of school bags_ communication skills and touch-typing. All lower primary students are hence equipped from the start to adopt a can-do attitude with a capacity for independent learning.   As part of the Total Curriculum to support the holistic development of students_ the Co-Curricular Activities (CCA) are designed to develop students' Attitudes_ Skills and Knowledge (ASK) in the cognitive_ physical and aesthetics domains. For P3 students who are embarking on CCA for the first time_ an experiential approach is adopted to enable students to experience and discover their interests and talents in the different CCA domains for the first semester. This also allows students to make a more informed choice for formal CCA in Semester 2. CCA is conducted within curriculum time so as to enable all students to be involved in it.

visionstatement_desc: Curious Minds_ Caring Hearts_ Creative Spirits
missionstatement_desc: To develop the whole child to be a force for good in the world
philosophy_culture_ethos: Palm View Primary School believes in the potential of every child. Each is unique_ and possesses the capacity to learn_ advance and succeed. We believe our children can be inspired towards excellence. As educators_ we are guardians of our children's future. To safeguard what is entrusted to us_ it is critical that we channel our educational efforts towards developing the whole child to be 21st century learners so that they can be a force for good in the world. This is our mission and calling.  We are guardians of children's curiosity for learning. Children are naturally curious. They question_ explore and wonder and so they grow and learn. At PLVPS_ we want our children to stay curious and develop an inquisitive spirit that thrives on exploration and discovery. This will better prepare them for an unpredictable world.  We are guardians of children's tender hearts for caring. Growing up in small nucleus families today_ we need to nurture children's gentle hearts towards love and care for others. At Palm View_ we cultivate_ in our children_ the virtue of looking out for the needs of others and to care deeply for those who are less fortunate than themselves.   We are guardians of our children's creative spirits. Children possess fertile imagination and view the world through their idiosyncratic lenses. Because creativity requires experimentation and enterprise_ our teachers understand the need to promote diversity and multiple perspectives even as they provide a large emotional safety net for our children to manage failures_ disappointments and discouragements. When we inspire children to dream big dreams and empower them to believe in themselves and their abilities_ they will develop confidence and achieve great things in life.    Curious Minds_ Caring Hearts_ Creative Spirits... this is our vision for our children.
special_sdp_offered: ACT-cellence Education through Drama Our P1 and P2 students undergo a Speech and Drama programme to enhance and enrich their learning in English and Mother Tongue. Our students are given the opportunity to showcase their talents to their parents at the end of the programme through the Little Theatre performances. Beyond formal curriculum_ drama is used in teaching values and Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) competencies through the school's Programme for Active Learning (PAL-Drama). We have been accorded the Applied Learning Programme (ALP) status for our ACT-cellence Education through Drama.   Palm View Challenge Palm View Challenge is a 6-year school-wide programme designed along different learning experiences aimed at developing children's life skills and values. Students at every level are challenged to complete different tasks_ each carefully designed to develop in them desirable character traits for the 21st century.  The tasks range from tree-top adventure_ school-based camps_ and community projects. These activities are intentionally designed with certain elements of challenge to the children_ so that in undergoing these experiences_ they will develop character traits of confidence_ empathy_ resilience_ courage_ as well as_ teamwork and communication.   One of the signature programmes in the Palm View Challenge is the Artizenry Project_ which helps the child understand the context of society and culture. Through our collaboration with the Yellow Ribbon Project_ students undergo meaning-making of issues using drama strategies_ and then_ as advocates_ make artworks to raise awareness and funds for the cause. We aim to impress upon our children how they can contribute to the betterment of society and in so doing be a force for good in the world.

visionstatement_desc: The Best from Each_ A Better Future for All - Riverside Primary School aspires to nurture Riverians as Joyful and Productive Learners and Connected Citizens of Good Character and bring out the best from each Riverian to lead_ serve and contribute as a member of the community and the world. To achieve our vision_ the school adopts a student-centric approach to know every child and grow every child in best ways possible and leverages people and partnerships to add value to the education process.
missionstatement_desc: Inspire Learning_ Nurture Character_ Build Community - Riverside Primary School sees its purpose in inspiring engaged and deep learning_ nurturing pupils in values_ character and citizenship_ and building a sense of identity and affiliation to the community and nation. The core business of education is conducted through a positive school tone of care_ respect and discipline; a safe and health-promoting school environment; and a vibrant and stimulating learning space.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Riverside Primary School holds strong beliefs that every child is unique and every child can learn. The work of the school and teachers is to provide a caring environment so that every child feels safe_ healthy and valued. It is also to ensure the best possible conditions for every child to be engaged_ supported and challenged_ thus learning and growing to the best of his/her potential.   The school educates not just for results; it educates for outcomes. The outcomes are to be seen in Riverians as Joyful and Productive Learners and Connected Citizens of Good Character who will SPARKLE with Strength of character_ Perseverance_ Adaptability_ Responsibility_ Kindness_ Leadership_ Enthusiasm and Sincerity.  The school recognises that people and partnerships are key to school and pupil success. The Confident_ Competent_ Caring and Committed Team Riverside works alongside our collaborative and supportive parents as well as partners with whom we have grown purposeful and sustainable partnerships in education.  The school motto "Learning Together_ Growing Together_ Sparkling Together" signifies that the school is a common social space for pupils to come together harmoniously to learn_ grow and sparkle together.   The school fosters a culture that is rich with inclusiveness and affiliation (For Riverside and Riverians) and propelled by learning and excellence (From Good to Great).
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme_ PlayWorks nurtures Riverians as critical and inventive thinkers and collaborative problem-solvers through play-and-design experiences using different tools and media. Pupils work in groups and apply the protocol "Understand_ Plan_ Design_ Build_ Improvise" to solve problems. Throughout the problem-solving process_ pupils demonstrate the SPARKLE Values and practise communication_ collaboration and reflection. At every grade level_ there is a signature PlayWorks module_ namely P1 LegoWorks_ P2 LegoWorks_ P3 PaperWorks and P4 ParkWorks. The PlayWorks protocol is also pervasively applied in English Language for writing_ Science for inquiry and Art for artmaking.    Values in Action (VIA) grows our Riverians as socially concerned and responsible citizens who have Awareness of community and environment concerns_ own a sense of Affiliation with the community and natural environment_ and are called to Action to lead_ serve and shape a cohesive community_ healthy environment and sustainable future for all. The key VIA programmes are "Gardening for a  Sustainable Future"_ "Project EARTH (Every Act of Recycling/Reusing/Reducing Truly Helps)" and "Keep Singapore Clean Movement in Schools".  The House System aims to nurture respect for diversity and sense of affiliation. Every Riverian belongs to a House and participates in inter-House events across classes and levels in a common space that embraces differences and fosters camaraderie. The signature House events are HouseWarming_ House Practice and Riverside Sports and Games Day.   RECCE (Riverian Exploration and Charting of Career and Education) guides Riverians to know themselves_ formulate their aspirations_ plan their pathways and take action to achieve their goals. Every Riverian will visit KidZania Singapore twice_ namely the Discovery Experience at P2 and the Future Charting Experience at P5. Every Riverian will develop an Individual Career and Education Plan by end-P6.

principal_name: MDM PHAN SWEE LIN SHERIN JACINTA
first_vp_name: MDM NUR SABARIAH BTE MOHD IBRAHIM
visionstatement_desc: Learners driven by Passion _  Leaders guided by Values
missionstatement_desc: At West Spring Primary School_ we provide opportunities for West Springers to realise and reach their potential whilst developing good character and citizenship.
philosophy_culture_ethos: West Spring Primary was established in 2014. We are guided by our philosophy that a positive learning environment that provides opportunities for students to experience big and small successes can be attained through meaningful learning and character development opportunities. This belief is captured through the school song that encourages students to be "thankful for this day [where they] will have joy in [their] hearts and love in [their] souls as [they] work towards [their] goals". We believe students enjoy coming to school when they are able to experience small and big successes.   Through this belief_ the school's approach to teaching and learning includes taking a refreshing approach to make learning a joy_ engaging and effective in mastering the skills and developing the disposition and attitude that will keep them open to lifelong learning.    The students' joy in coming to school is due to the hard work of the school community of committed teachers_ staff and very supportive parents and partners who believe in the school's vision. The school community aspires for excellence in our pursuits.
special_sdp_offered: The school believes in nurturing both the academic potential of our students and their character development.  The school adopts the PLAY (Purposeful Learning Activities for the Young) approach to Teaching and Learning. This approach engages students through Cognitive PLAY_ Physical PLAY_ Object PLAY_ Dramatic PLAY and ICT PLAY. This approach helps a child move from kindergarten to lower primary and continue to flourish.  Building upon the PLAY approach in lower primary_ the school provides an integrated platform for students to develop critical and inventive thinking skills through the STEM (Science_ Technology_ Engineering and Mathematics) approach to teaching and learning. The early introduction of scientific and engineering thinking through the use of LEGO and Scientists@PLAY in Primary 1 and 2 provides the foundation on which the STEM approach builds upon. All Primary 3 and 4 students experience coding for fun as part of their modular CCA among other programmes that allow them a hands-on approach to problem solving and inventive thinking.  CHARM - Character Matters - is the school's signature character development programme for all students. These values-based lessons include engaging activities for students to visualise and experience how to demonstrate good values and behaviour. Other Character and Citizenship Education programmes include the following: -Six Kinds of Best hands-on programme based on David Koutsoukis' vision of helping young people develop good values and contribute to society -ACTIVATE (Action to Inculcate the Values of Teamwork) to help students develop good habits for life. This is nurtured when students clean up after themselves at recess and at the end of the school day and also at home with their family. -Friend of Singa Ambassadors to promote kindness among schoolmates -Cultivating Leaders of Values (CLOVE) programme to develop our students holistically using the Jim Kouzes and Barry Posner's The Five Practices of Exemplary Leadership

visionstatement_desc: Reflective Learner_ Empathic Designer and Inspiring Leader.
missionstatement_desc: We create a caring_ safe and stimulating school environment where each child can grow and glow.  We seek to build in our students a strong foundation in literacy and numeracy_ as well as equip them with the attitude_ values and 21st century skills to be future-ready and to engage the world while remaining rooted to Singapore.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Every child matters_ is unique_ and has the potential to make a difference.   Every staff member is an asset_ has different strengths_ and wants to contribute. Every parent and community partner is a valuable contributor in nurturing the child to G.L.O.W.  We believe that all children can learn and be successful_ and that they learn best when they are connected_ cared for_ and cherished.  By providing them with a strong foundation in literacy and numeracy_ and inculcating in each child the right attitudes_ values_ as well as equipping them with the 21st century competencies_  they can become creative problem-solvers_ articulate communicators_ effective team players_ life-long learners_ and responsible citizens committed to the well-being of Singapore and fellow Singaporeans.  This is realised through the collaborative efforts of the school_ parents_ and community partners.  Our HER3OIC Values Harmony_ Empathy_ Resilience_ Respect_ Responsibility_ Optimism_ Integrity & Creativity
special_sdp_offered: Lifeskills@ALPS Students are taught the ALPS HER3OIC values_ and Character Champions are identified and recognised with inputs from peers and teachers. The school adopts evidence-based principles such as breathing exercises and focused attention to help students regulate their emotions and raise their self-awareness as well as awareness of the people and things around them.  Student Leadership Development All students are given opportunity to lead in pledge-taking at morning assemblies. The Class Committee allows all students to be responsible for an area in class.  ALPS Ambassadors are trained to play host to visitors at school events.  ALPS Environmental Programme This aims to develop responsible citizens with an ecological conscience.  It inculcates in students awareness of environmental issues and the part they can play_ including a commitment to "always leave a place cleaner than before" through actions like daily cleaning of canteen and classrooms.  Students also assume responsibility to educate their families about environmental conservation.  ALPS Toymaker This teaches children to find joy in a toy they make themselves using simple or recycled materials.  It also raises awareness of the scientific principles behind how toys work.  The ALPS Toymaker Card guides students in designing_ making and explaining  how their toy works.  Shortlisted projects are submitted for the Sony Creative Science Award.  Design Thinking as a Way of Life The focus is on laying the attitude and values foundation for DT_ in particular_ empathy_ collaboration_ optimism_ respect and resilience.  This is carried out through the Lifeskills@ALPS and complemented by the Little Designers Programme and the Design for Change Challenge where students work in teams to identify the needs within the school and community and create solutions for them.

visionstatement_desc: Learning and Leading with HEART
missionstatement_desc: Instilling Core Values_ Igniting the Love for Learning_ Inspiring Excellence
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our philosophy is "Nurture Every Child_ Every Child Rooted in Core Values_ Prepare the child for future learning_ Every Child engaged in learning and Caring staff".  Every child is like a young plant_ where they will be nurtured and developed in Northoaks. We want our children to be passionate in all that they do and our teaching and learning approaches is one that is child-centric_ to give the best to every child.   Every child will be given the opportunity to grow and glow and be outstanding in whatever they do_ not necessarily being the top. We believe that every child can excel and we create the environment for the child to grow. We want our child to be appreciative of the opportunities to learn and do their best.  Every child will be rooted in the school core values of HEART - Honesty_ Empathy_ Appreciation_ Respect and Tenacity. We consciously imbue in our students these core values through their learning and doing.
special_sdp_offered: We develop our child through our Special Student Development Programme - The Leader in Me - where we focus on the 7 Habits of Highly Effective People to build lifeskills in our students. Every child can be a leader and through the programme_ we teach our children to be a leader of themselves_ be proactive in learning and demonstrating the school core values.  "Project Heart" is a two-week programme to reinforce the school core values. Through "I choose to be a bucker filler" and "the five languages of love"_ our children go through activities to learn and internalize the school core values.   "HEART Vits" targeting at the lower primary students aims to inculcate in children the school values through story-reading. The school is adopting the Curriculum Integration through Innovation (CI+I)@Northoaks to enable authentic learning by introducing "real world" skills in connection with integrated academic knowledge to the students. In the VUCA world_ as challenges may swing a person to move from his/her values; CI+I@Northoaks will also want to reconcile the want to innovate with the need to be rooted in moral principles.  The school recognises the importance and meaning in integrating curriculum to deepen student learning. Innovation_ which is a way of thinking that involves the ideation of new ideas_ processes and/or products that are of value_ will be the overarching concept used to integrate IP and non-IP curriculum. The school will introduce CI+I through the 6-year of Primary education and children will go through_ progressively_ the innovation protocol.  In the area of Arts_ our children get to do the works of great artists like Kusama_ Acrimboldo_ Keith Haring. Not only do they present works based on these artists_ they are also given opportunities for art appreciation and critique.

visionstatement_desc: Confident Leaders_ Caring Citizens
missionstatement_desc: To Engage and Empower all students to be future-ready and to go above and beyond to care_ learn and serve.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We believe that every child can learn and wants to learn. We are committed to provide a holistic education and a safe_ nurturing environment for students to grow and learn. We seek to equip them with values_ attitudes and skills to prepare them for the future. We do our best to provide a culture of care that will motivate and engage every learner. We believe in promoting positive student behaviours and development of thinking skills. We emphasise the importance of gratitude and respect for all. We strive to ignite students' passion for learning through designing learning experiences and delivering comprehensive curriculum that will meet their learning needs.
special_sdp_offered: We aim to develop leadership qualities and skills among students_ so as to provide them with an edge in overcoming future challenges and thrive in the changing global landscape. We aim to nurture our charges to be positive influencers in life and in their relationships with others. Our two-tiered student leadership development programme focuses on personal mastery_ teamwork and responsible citizenship_ as well as leadership development to serve the school and community. In alignment with our mission_ we teach 21st century competencies.  Students will learn basic computational thinking (CT) concepts and attitudes through interdisciplinary themes in our "Nurturing Problem Solvers through CT" programme. They will have opportunities to learn coding and apply makerspace ideas to tinker and make robots. Our "Code for Fun" programme is supported by IDA under the Code@SG movement. To equip students with skills to manage themselves and relate well with others_ we run a progressive lifeskills programme from P1 to P6.   They learn important social and emotional competencies_ namely self-awareness_ social awareness_ self-management_ relationship management and responsible decision making_ through outdoor camps and authentic learning experiences.

visionstatement_desc: Every student an educated child and contributing citizen_ ready to serve and lead.
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing the Whole Child_ Growing Future Leaders
philosophy_culture_ethos: Value: Empathy   Characteristics and Practices of Empathy: 1) Appreciates the perspective of others_ always see where others are coming from and seek consensus. Do not reject a person based on differences or biasness.  2) Listens and seeks to understand_ practise listening to understand others. Seek to understand before seeking to be understood.  Value: Mindfulness  Characteristics and Practices of Mindfulness: 1) Having self and social awareness. Understand who we are and our impact on others. Understand what we are good at and how we can make use of it to serve others.  2) Has the ability to appreciate beauty in the aesthetics and the environment. Knowing how to appreciate music_ art and the environment. Knowing how to take care of the physical environment.  3) Is able to organise thoughts and information meaningfully before acting. Putting thoughts and information together coherently and meaningfully to derive knowledge and wisdom for action before acting. Stop. Think. Do.  4) Able to anticipate. Seeing what is happening around us and remembering events of the past to anticipate future opportunities and threats.  Value: Care  Characteristics and Practices of Care: 1) Has the ability to take care of self and others. Knowing how to take care of one's health and physical development. Being conscious in caring for others. Knowing how to be safe.  2) Believes in contributing to_ caring for and serving the family and community. Identify and attend to each other's needs at home_ in school and the community. Building a school community that serves with care.  3) Able to convince and win others over. Using sound reasons to convince others of our proposition. An approach that does not run-down others. Helping others to see the larger good and meeting the needs of and caring for the larger community.
special_sdp_offered: Holistic English Literacy Program (HELP)  We envision every student to be an educated child and a contributing citizen_ ready to serve and lead. In line with this vision_ the English department has anchored a distinctive program_ Holistic English Literacy Program (HELP) with the intent of imparting language skills to our students so that they feel empowered to use these skills in their community service learning projects.   To enable learners to emerge as effective leaders in their own right_ we strive on fostering a learning environment that extends far beyond the classroom walls. This "service learning" acts as a catalyst in enhancing both_ student growth and the common good. Most importantly_ it recognises the need to engage pupils in a natural learning process that is real and purpose driven. The underpinning belief in the development of this program is that children will be motivated to learn if they are presented with a strong purpose to do so.  Purposefully crafted activities intend to help young people acquire the skills_ attitudes_ and beliefs that fully engage them in community life and help them move from the periphery of their community to its center.  We believe that an emphasis on the public good challenges young minds to identify needs and strengths_  both in themselves and their community and to find creative ways for improving community conditions. HELP serves as an avenue to fulfil our school's vision of being a place where all students engage in learning_ achieve to the best of their ability_ and become productive citizens and participants of the community.

visionstatement_desc: Passionate Learners_ Caring Leaders
missionstatement_desc: To build a community of learners - Inspiring self and others to lead with a heart
philosophy_culture_ethos: Oasis Primary School (OPS) believes that every child can learn and achieve when their needs_ interests and abilities are looked into.  We are committed to provide quality education for all children so that they can develop holistically in their moral_ emotional_ social_ cognitive_ aesthetic and physical domains and become "Passionate Learners_ Caring Leaders"_ children who are capable of learning and innovating continuously. More importantly_ they are able to take good care of themselves_ their families and the less-privileged_ and in turn_ contribute back to the society that has nurtured them.  The name of the school conjures up an image of a sanctuary where one can find safety and sustenance that provides an experience that is challenging and enriching. It evolves around building an oasis within a trying environment (desert) where innovations_ strengths and positive attributes are necessary to overcome adversities.    Beyond equipping the students with an excellent foundation in literacy and numeracy_ the school's programmes will also help them to acquire skills_ instincts and competencies to traverse the "desert" of tomorrow. The focus will be on processes and skills for the 21st century_ in particular communication and teamwork_ collaboration_ creative problem-solving_ cultural intelligence and critical thinking. In OPS_ we will engage the parents and together with our teachers_ concerted efforts will be made to inculcate the R3ICH (Respect_ Responsibility_ Resilience_ Integrity_ Care and Harmony) values among the students.
special_sdp_offered: 1) The Leader in Me Programme The school adopts a two-pronged approach in the teaching of 7 Habits namely through explicit teaching and integration of the 7 Habits into the curriculum. For explicit teaching_ teachers who are trained will engage the students through thoughtfully designed activities. To ensure pervasiveness in the school_ the habits are reinforced through curriculum integration with different focus at different levels.  With pervasive implementation of "The Leader in Me"_ every child will be able to manage and lead self_ as well as others confidently. This arises from strong self and social awareness_ the ability to manage relationship and make responsible decisions - all of which are important attributes of a Confident Person.  2) Speech and Drama (English & Mother Tongue Languages) The programme aims to engage the students in the oral domain of the languages. Students learn to work and solve problems together as a team. The training sessions help them create remarkable theatre from scratch and build up their level of confidence to speak in front of an audience. Teachers and students would also have opportunities to work together to create settings and scenarios from their own imaginative ideas and this would improve teacher-student interaction.  3) Programme for Active Learning (PAL) PAL gives our students the chance to learn beyond the four walls of a classroom to discover new interests_ learn new skills and build their characters_ besides providing opportunities for them to develop confidence and forge friendship. PAL modules are experiential in nature and incorporate learning in a creative_ fun and enjoyable way. Through their participation in this programme_ our students become more confident with themselves_ exhibit more leadership qualities and learn to take care and respect others.

second_vp_name: MR DALJIT SINGH S/O DARBARA SINGH
visionstatement_desc: A Life-long Learner_ A Gracious Citizen
missionstatement_desc: To build a vibrant environment that nurtures young minds and builds upright character
philosophy_culture_ethos: We believe that education must prepare a child for life and work in the future.  We want to develop in our pupils the passion_ the skills and the aptitude for learning so that they will be self-directed to learn_ know how to learn and be always ready to acquire new knowledge and skills.   We want to build character in our pupils so that they will grow up with sound values_ be confident persons doing what is good and right_ taking care of their family_ working well with others and contributing to society.    We believe in working in partnership with parents so that together we provide the best education possible for children to grow and develop right attitudes_ beliefs_ values and behaviour.
special_sdp_offered: We provide a holistic education for our pupils to prepare them for life and work in the future. We want learning to be fun and meaningful. Some of our key programmes include:  Orators@Waterway: Orators@Waterway is a six-year programme to nurture pupils to be gracious persons_ engaging communicators and confident leaders.  Approach - Experiential learning_ peer learning_ role-modelling and coaching from mentors. Lessons include dramatisation_ storytelling_ topical sharing_ news writing_ literature appreciation_ programme hosting_ persuasive speaking_ debating and interview skills.  Good Morning School: Sharing every morning before the start of school on a wide range of subjects such as current affairs_ world events_ science_ art and music to expose pupils to the world outside their classroom and Singapore.     Chinese Language Enrichment Course: A fun-filled and activity-based programme for pupils to develop an interest and appreciation of the Chinese Language and culture. Values are taught through classics (Di Zi Gui) --- Standards for Being a Good Pupil and Child.  Flipped Classroom: Waterway Primary School adopts Flipped Classroom to promote learning beyond the classroom. Teachers prepare lessons and upload them for pupils to learn at their own pace or to relearn the lessons when needed. Teachers may also direct pupils to access some resources on the internet which can then be used for lively discussions in the classroom. While some of the learning is done outside of class lessons_ teachers can use classroom lesson time to focus on higher order or more complex learning processes such as applying_ analysing_ evaluating_ creating_ etc.

visionstatement_desc: na
missionstatement_desc: na
philosophy_culture_ethos: Fern Green Primary School is designed as a school within a garden. Sited within an oasis of greenery_ the school environment beckons Students into its fold to partake in exciting learning activities that are in store for all learners.  The school believes that effective learning takes place when learner needs drive lesson designs. We believe that each child is active and inquisitive and wants to explore. As our children make the transition from kindergarten_ we would like to keep their innate curiosity alive and nurture them into well-rounded_ passionate_ and curious lifelong learners.  Our instructional approaches begin with Inquiry. Through the use of thought-provoking questions_ we would like to spark our students' curiosity and inspire in them a genuine need to learn so that they care about the outcome of their investigations. Underpinning the design of Fern Green's academic curriculum and co-curriculum is our school values of Respect_ Responsibility_ Resilience_ Integrity_ Care and Harmony.  The school would leverage School-Home-Community Partnership to avail our children of a holistic learning experience. We hope to work closely with Parents to reinforce values taught as well as foster our children's motivation to learn and ask questions_ and encourage them to pursue what they love.
special_sdp_offered: na

visionstatement_desc: A Caring and Creative Learning Community in the Pursuit of Excellence
missionstatement_desc: To nurture every child to his best.
philosophy_culture_ethos: First Toa Payoh Primary School (FTPPS) was established in 1968 at Lorong 1_ Toa Payoh.  On 2 January 2002_ the school was relocated to its current premise at Lorong 8_ Toa Payoh. Being the first school in Toa Payoh_ the school retained its distinctive name.   FTPPS believes that Every Child Matters and Deserves an Education. It is with this belief that we partner our key stakeholders in our mission to nurture every student in FTPPS to his best potential and to realise the school vision of  a caring and creative learning community in the pursuit of excellence.  In all our endeavours_ we anchor in our school values of Respect_ Responsibility_ Love_ Integrity and Perseverance (R2 LIP). The school strives to unleash the potential of every student in FTPPS through joy for learning.
special_sdp_offered: FTPPS endeavours to deliver a student centric_ values driven education to enable them to attain the 4 FTPPS Student Outcomes - a confident person_ a self-directed learner_ an active contributor and a concerned citizen.  In Literacy through Photography(LTP)_ which is the school's Learning for Life Programme_ we aim to nurture students to be self-directed and confident learners who are ICT savvy and can articulate their thoughts and inspirations through their photographs. LTP also seeks to develop active contributors who can cooperate and collaborate in teams during the photography sessions and nurture concerned citizens who are able to portray green efforts and raise awareness of the environment through photography.  The school believes in "Every Student_ A Leader" -our guiding principle behind our student leadership programme where we nurture the leadership potential of every child. Our student leadership training programme focuses on equipping our students with the emerging 21st century competencies.  The school has a structured 6-year Values-in-Action(VIA) programme that engages students in authentic experiences. Leveraging the expanding environment approach to maximise learning impact_ the programme allows students to learn progressively from first contributing to their homes_ then to the school_ and finally to the community and beyond.  An experiential approach is adopted for the promotion of nature conservation through our Environmental Education Programme- GoGreen@FTPPS. Students learn about Reduce_ Reuse and Recycle through hands-on activities_ outdoor camps and collaborative programmes with our stakeholders.  Our Global-Local Exchange Programme aims to give our students a head start in broadening their worldview_ developing the ability to work with people from diverse cultural backgrounds and instilling in them a sense of commitment and rootedness to Singapore. Our students have the opportunities to participate in learning journeys to Hong Kong and Malacca.

visionstatement_desc: Learning beyond Borders_ Caring beyond Self
missionstatement_desc: We nurture passionate learners_ strong in character.
philosophy_culture_ethos: New Town Primary provides a nurturing and holistic education through our unique brand of education that empowers our students to grow into confident_ self-directed individuals and caring citizens. Built upon the School's Philosophy that Every Child can Learn and wants to Learn_ the school focuses on providing differentiated learning experiences for each and every child to help them discover and hone their many passions and pursuits.  Beyond academic excellence_ the school is committed to inculcate sound values in our students to be active contributors to the society. There is a pervasive culture of care in the school with strong emphasis on character development and nurturing a growth mindset. Our students are given opportunities to work in teams. The school has grown over the years and done well in many aspects due to a team of dedicated and caring staff_ supportive parents_ alumni and the school advisory committee.
special_sdp_offered: Student Leadership Programme In NTPS_ we put values education at the centre of what we do. Based on our school motto "Ready to Serve"_ our 6-year Student Leadership Programme is grounded in character as the core foundation. A key feature of the programme is the opportunity for all students to take up a leadership position.  The range of leadership opportunities_ varying in skills and impact_ include Line Monitors at the lower primary level_ Subject Monitors at the middle primary and House Leaders at the upper primary level. As we believe that leadership is about making a positive difference in one's sphere of influence_ our student leaders engage in projects that create a positive social change in the home (P1&2)_ school (P3&4) and the community (P5&6). Guided by the framework of the leadership gurus_ Kouzes & Posner_ our students learn The 5 Practices of Exemplary Leadership - "Model the Way"_ "Inspire a Shared Vision"_ "Challenge the Process"_ "Enable Others to Act" and "Encourage the Heart". Through the trainings and opportunities_ our students develop self and team leadership skills as they work with one another toward their shared goals.  Learn@NTPS Our curriculum nurtures a sense of wonder in our students. Apart from building a strong foundation in literacy and numeracy_ we encourage students to explore and develop their interests. They include: Speech & Drama_ "How Things Work"_ Math Olympiads and Excellence-2000 (Math & Science enrichment programme). Our students have experimented with the different ways a boat can be constructed_ and explored the different vegetables Singapore could grow in times of food shortage.  Through our "Cultural Connections Programme" with schools in China and Southeast Asia_ they have learnt to appreciate the diversity of different cultures. Our 22 CCAs_ ranging from Robotics_ International Dance_ to Netball and Red Cross_ have enabled our students to develop sportsmanship_ appreciate beauty and find a voice.

visionstatement_desc: The Garden where diversity blossoms
missionstatement_desc: Together we nurture for a better future
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Boon Lay Garden Primary School - the Garden where diversity blossoms_ we believe that every child is unique and deserves a vibrant learning environment to pursue his/her passion_ discover strengths and maximize potential.  We aim to nurture students who are Future Ready with Strong Fundamentals - each a Thinker_ Leader and Contributor imbued in values and equipped with knowledge_ skills and competencies.    We embrace all our students who come from diverse backgrounds and demonstrate the culture of care by providing them a safe and nurturing environment. Teachers establish positive teacher-student relationships so that they feel secured and happy. This positive bond with the students creates supportive spaces for their learning and well-being.     We believe in developing students who are rooted in values. The school's character education programme anchored on our CAREs values (Cooperation_ A* Attitude_ Respect_ Effort Leading to Success in Everything We Do) aims to nurture students who exhibit these values in the school and beyond. Teachers demonstrate CAREs values for students to observe and learn from examples.    We are a school that seeks to maximize the diverse talents and interests of each child by providing a total learning experience in the cognitive_ social moral_ aesthetic and leadership domains. We inspire our students to achieve their dreams. We create a vibrant learning institution where both students and staff are holistically developed to be the best they can be to embrace the future.
special_sdp_offered: Applied Learning Programme - Habits of Mind (HOM) The school embarked on HOM to enable students to go through thinking processes and display thinking dispositions to become self-directed learners. Students acquire knowledge and skills during the explicit teaching of HOM. The games approach is used to teach these habits and inject the element of fun. Video clips_ group activities and reflections provide a myriad of learning experiences. Students also engage in activities conducted during pre-assembly sessions and continue the fun of learning beyond the curriculum by using board games. These habits are further integrated in the academic and non-academic subjects to enable students to internalize and display the thinking dispositions of self-directed learners.  Learning Buffet Learning Buffet is a platform where students immerse themselves in the Hi-5 experience-Intellectual_ Technological_ Art and Cultural_ Life-skills and Leadership. The school transforms into borderless classrooms where students have the autonomy to select and attend workshops based on their interests. Hands-on learning experiences enable them to discover their strengths and ignite their curiosity.   Innovators' Hatter Day Innovators' Hatter Day-a day of ideation which allows students to think and come out with creative solutions to authentic problems. Students are presented with innovative modifications of everyday items to expose them to authentic problems and solutions. This progresses to Hatter Challenge where they are encouraged to identify challenges around them_ brainstorm ideas and build prototypes as part of the solutions.  On this day_ students showcase their Inter-disciplinary Project Work (IPW) by presenting their research-based solutions to current and anticipated problems. This prepares them to become future-ready problem solvers. Concurrent to the IPW exhibition is Innocube-a Thinking Hub where students use recycled materials to illustrate and share ideas on environmental problems.

visionstatement_desc: Every Marsilian can Learn_ Lead and Serve
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Responsible Learners and Compassionate Leaders
philosophy_culture_ethos: Established in 1958_ Marsiling Primary School (MPS) has one of the longest history and heritage among schools in the Marsiling/Woodlands estate. The Marsiling Experience is anchored on a student-centric_ values-driven_ and holistic education to equip our students with the relevant skills and competencies to navigate a fast-changing world_ and to develop them to become Responsible Learners and Compassionate Leaders who can Learn_ Lead and Serve.  OUR PHILOSOPHY In MPS_ we believe that developing the 21st century competencies and the focus on meaningful student engagement will enhance our students' cognitive and affective development_ and eventual success in life. We will continue to inculcate the right values in our students and equip them with the relevant knowledge_ skills and attitudes to better prepare them for future challenges. Through a comprehensive academic and co-curricular programme_ anchored on student centric and values-driven learning_ we hope to nurture all our students to achieve their full potential. In their 6 years at MPS_ our students will grow to become Responsible Learners and Compassionate Leaders_ ready to serve the community and nation as active young citizens.  OUR SCHOOL VALUES The school values are encapsulated in the acronym R2IC2E (Respect_ Responsibility_ Integrity_ Commitment_ Care and Esprit de Corps) and integrated into both the formal and informal curriculum of the school.  OUR SCHOOL MOTTO The school motto Ilmu Suluh Hidup (translated to mean 'Knowledge lights up our Lives')_ as reflected in the school crest_ continues to be of relevance today. The four interlocking rings represent our closely-knit multi-racial school population working in harmony. The stalk of padi is symbolic of hard work and effort required for success. The star reflects the belief we have that every student can achieve and education (symbolised by the pen) will blaze the way ahead for our students (as shown by the torch).
special_sdp_offered: In MPS_ school-based curriculum innovation_ values-based holistic development_ enhancing teachers' capacity_ and building strong school-home partnerships are key drivers in developing the 21st century Marsilian learner.  We strive to instil in every Marsilian our core values of R2IC2E and nurture responsible active citizenship through service leadership. The school's Character and Citizenship Education programme is anchored on student and service leadership. The student leadership programme 'LEAD to Serve@MPS' focuses on developing each student's capacity to lead and influence others. The 'Green Citizenship' programme engages students in collective action as they learn to take care of the school and the environment together with their peers.    The school has developed milestone programmes in both the academic and non-academic domains to build strong fundamentals in learning_ develop students' talents and interests_ and prepare our learners for the future. Examples of these programmes include: - 'Champions@Math' equips students with problem-solving strategies and challenges them to work on increasingly more complex problems as they progress up the levels.  - 'Junior Science' and 'S.U.P.E.R Experience' equip our lower primary students with basic scientific knowledge and skills_ develop their sense of curiosity and pique their interest in Science.  - 'Readers Theatre' builds students' confidence and reading fluency through fun and purposeful learning activities and opportunities for performance.  - 'Effective Communications Skills' aims to develop Marsilians as competent communicators and confident bilinguals.  - Art and Music Masterclasses provide a platform to identify talents and develop the passion of Marsilians in the Performing Arts.

visionstatement_desc: Our vision of being 'a vibrant school that inspires excellence' aspires our students as one who is rooted in values_ innovative in thoughts and passionate in actions.
missionstatement_desc: Our mission is 'to nurture confident and self-directed learners who exhibit social responsibility and character'.
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school believes that knowledge and skills must be anchored in values and character development. While we help every student go as far as he can_ the ultimate goal is to develop him into one who can thrive in the globalised world with a sound moral and ethical compass. We complement parents' role in imparting values and work closely with parents to achieve this. The school core values are Care_ Respect_ Integrity_ Responsibility_ Resilience and Excellence. The school sees teachers as the key in nurturing every child for the future and takes pride in espousing a culture of care.
special_sdp_offered: Melody@Pei Tong (LLP) aims to make learning of music fun and enjoyable so that students will continue to learn and appreciate music throughout their lives. Music lessons are enriched through the "Engaging with Songs" programme and creative music-making.   Programme for Active Leaning develops the social and emotional competencies in P1 and P2 students through fun and varied activities.  It is experiential in nature_ encompasses learning in a creative way and incorporates values education.  All P3 to P6 students participate in co-curricular activities to allow them to pursue their passions and interests outside the classrooms and provide opportunities for interaction among students from different races_ classes and levels.   School leverages technologies to create a stimulating learning experience for students. All classrooms are equipped with Interactive Whiteboards. For P5 and P6_ laptops and iPads are used in the wireless environment to promote self-directed and collaborative learning.   CCE A.L.I.V.E! (school-based values education programme)_ provides opportunities for students to take ownership of their Values in Action experiences through teacher's facilitation and reflections after execution.

visionstatement_desc: Yuhualite -One who Cares_ Shares and ContributesOne who Learns_ Thinks and Innovates
missionstatement_desc: Growing Our Hearts and Minds
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school believes that every pupil is different_ each has his unique talent and the ability to learn.  As such_ the school seeks to create a learning environment whereby their learning experiences are both meaningful and purposeful to engage their hearts and minds so that every Yuhualite will be a thinking individual who cares and contributes to the community and the country.  Underpinning this belief is the school mission_ vision and values: Resilience_ Responsibility_ Respect_ Integrity_ Care and Harmony
special_sdp_offered: Learning for Life Programme (LLP): Building Good Character through Music and the Performing Arts  Yuhua Primary School recognises the importance of music in nurturing well-rounded individuals and the opportunities that Music curriculum can provide in preparing pupils for life. The school has a 6-year plan for their Music and Performing Arts programmes_ catering to pupils from different levels of musical inclinations. The programme has been recognised by MOE as a distinctive programme under the LLP since 2014 and it aims to further develop their pupils' passion for lifelong learning through its Music and the Performing Arts programme_ grounded in values.  The school has a Music Garden to facilitate the teaching and learning of Music through outdoor musical installations in an outdoor environment.  The outdoor education learning facility enhances the formal Music curricula and supports the school's effort to build good character through Music and the Performing Arts.  School-based Innovation  The school has an innovation programme which aims to develop pupils in the 21st Century Competencies.  A theme is set for each level with specially customized programme to equip their pupils with the necessary skills through the Information and Communications Technology (ICT)-enriched lessons and authentic learning experiences at difference stages of their learning.  The programme requires pupils to think innovatively and communicate confidently while working independently or collaborating in teams.   The school also adopted Paul's Wheel of Reasoning model to provide a focus in developing their pupils' critical and creative thinking (CCT) skills.   The innovation programme facilitates developing pupils' talents in the area of innovation and enterprise (I&E). It aims to extend the learning within the curriculum further for I&E. Through the programme_ pupils learn to identify and apply ideation and problem solving-techniques to be an innovator and entrepreneur.

first_vp_name: MR RAJINDER SINGH S/O PIARA SINGH
visionstatement_desc: Anchored Hearts_ Driven Minds_ Leaders of Tomorrow
missionstatement_desc: To nurture loyal individuals with strength of character and determination to succeed in the spirit of lifelong learning.
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Fengshan_ we believe that every child has a talent and as a school_ we strive to bring out the best in the learner by providing a student-centric and values-driven education. As a school we remain committed to nurturing our students to be loyal individuals with strength of character and a determination to succeed in the spirit of lifelong learning. As a school we focus on delivering quality cognitive development programmes as well as a meaningful and vibrant co-curriculum that aims to enrich their educational experiences. The school seeks to develop our students to become Leaders of Tomorrow who will influence and contribute to the community through their compassionate leadership and excellence mindset. In nurturing and developing Leaders with Anchored Hearts and Driven Minds_ the focus on CCE and Leadership Development is an essential part of our curriculum.
special_sdp_offered: Fengshan Primary School strives to develop the 21st century competencies in our students by leveraging the classroom as well as school-wide platforms.  The millennial student will be one who is independent and yet interdependent.  To achieve this aim_ the school's Programme for Active Learning (PAL) offers learning experiences to develop soft skills in our students such as the ability to communicate clearly and cooperate with others_ and instil the belief in their abilities to accomplish a task or deal with a challenge.  At the upper levels_ the Interdisciplinary Project Work focuses on real-life problems to help students make sound decisions based on assessing various alternatives. Such learning transcends teaching from textbooks.  The school's Values In Action Programme_ such as Project Get-to-know_ Include & Value the Elderly_ educates our students to be giving and responsible citizens through community involvement while providing opportunities for leadership qualities inculcation to become compassionate "Leaders of Tomorrow".   Overarching all that the school does is our commitment to inculcate the 'Can Do' Spirit in our students_ to develop their resilience and to reinforce the culture of care and support for one another.  As part of the Character Focused Programme_ the school infuses the development of a Champion Mindset and concept of Bucket Filling - both emphasising the importance of working hard and working together_ to be reslient and self-reliant_ and also a caring team player.  This is further reinforced by the school's Learning for Life Programme which provides a common ground for students of different backgrounds to learn and excel in more than one sport_ while building on the social & emotional competencies in our students.

visionstatement_desc: A Vibrant and Connected Community that Aspires_ Learns and Leads
missionstatement_desc: Together_ we build an inviting and enriched environment to nurture passionate learners_ creative thinkers and caring leaders.
philosophy_culture_ethos: "Yeu Nerng School' was founded by the late Mr Huang Hua Long and four villagers as a humble Chinese School in 1935. 82 years on_ the school has become a government school_ and continues to grow together with the Bedok community. Since Yu Neng Primary School has established itself as a school of choice_ recognised for its excellence in both the academic and non-academic domains_ with outstanding achievement particularly in Sports and ICT.   In tandem with Singapore's rapid development over the decades_ Yu Neng too_ has evolved over time. Guided by the school values GR3IT - Graciousness_ Respect_ Responsibility_ Resilience_ Integrity_ and Teamwork_ we are committed to prepare our students to be future-ready and ready to handle the challenges of the volatile and complex world.  The 6-year Yu Neng Experience aims to nurture passionate learners_ creative thinkers and caring leaders where learning opportunities are accessible to all_ regardless of backgrounds. By providing a student-centric values driven education_ we want to inspire every student to 'think big and dream big' and to provide them with the necessary support_ platforms and opportunities to excel and thrive in the 21st century.
special_sdp_offered: The well-rounded 6-year curriculum is designed to provide every student the opportunity to grow the joy of learning_ demonstrate thinking and creativity_ and nurture leadership skills. A variety of pedagogical approaches are adopted to engage the mind_ heart and hands of the students. The school's vibrant learning environment_ supported by ICT_ extends learning beyond the classrooms and lends a leading edge for our students in the knowledge-driven society.  Building on our strength in ICT_ Yu Neng (YN) offers the Applied Learning Programme "3E Experiences@YNPS" which seeks to nurture every YN student to be Future-ready 21st Century Learners. The school-wide 6 year programme provides all students with the "Exposure" where they will gain in 6 different 'aspects'_ namely baseline ICT skills_ coding skills_ aesthetics_ multimedia production and cyber wellness. Students who demonstrate aptitude and interest in ICT will have the opportunity to be part of the "Engagement" and "Excellence" experience. One of the  accolades includes the co-development of a financial literacy app_ The Mighty Savers_ by P4 students with OCBC to teach primary school children the importance of managing money wisely. Riding on the past decades of Sport excellence in Table tennis and Badminton_ YN is moving on to provide for Learning for Life with a focus on Sports and Leadership. We believe that our students can develop a robustness of character and grit_ instill a desire to strive for excellence through the provision of an inclusive sports culture. The Creative Arts programme aims to cultivate students' interest in and appreciation for the arts. Our students would have the opportunities to create art animation_ ceramics and 3D printing. Beyond skills and techniques_ the school also facilitated performance and exhibition opportunities at school_ community and national platforms. This process enables students to build and develop soft skills that will enable them to thrive in the future.

first_vp_name: MR MOHAMED YAZEED BIN MOHAMED SAID
visionstatement_desc: Every Xinminite_ a confident citizen of character_ ready for the future.
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing the hearts and minds of Xinminites for a changing world.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We are guided by the philosophy of "Building Positive Relationships" in our efforts to build a culture of care and collegiality.  We strive to bring the best out in every student and allow space for them to discover their talents through our Xinmin Experience.  There is a strong emphasis on character formation and inculation of values.  Through our Xinmin Experience_ we build a culture of care_ respect_ responsibility and resilience.  A caring environment is evident where students and staff show care and concern for each other. We believe that by having close and positive relationships with our students_ staff_ parents and other stakeholders_ our students will become confident citizens of character_ who is ready for the future.
special_sdp_offered: CLOVE (Cultivating a Life of Values and Excellence) @ Xinmin Primary is our LLP.   This programme is an integral part of the curriculum at all levels.  This is done by: i. Creating Learning Opportunities in Formal Curriculum ii. Exposure for All in Sports & Co-Curricular Programmes iii.Values Education through Fun and Memorable Activities  Students are given many opportunities to experience character traits_ see them in action_ and feel them rather than just talk about them. Community-based_ real-world experiences that illustrate character traits are included in the curriculum. Values in Action_ student leadership_ cooperative learning and peer mentoring are important parts of the approach. Ample time is also allowed for discussion and reflection.   There are also opportunities for students to be involved in exchange programme with schools in China and Malaysia .

visionstatement_desc: Every Yangzhengnite a Passionate Learner_ Caring Friend and Responsible Citizen.
missionstatement_desc: Yangzheng Primary is committed to providing a supportive environment that will help every pupil develop his moral_ cognitive_ physical_ social_ aesthetic and leadership capabilities to his fullest potential.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Pupils and Staff in Yangzheng are guided by our school's motto and philosophy of "From Each His Finest Effort".  We provide a nurturing environment that focuses on the learning processes and effort_ and not just on the outcomes.  The philosophy is supported by the school's culture that manifests itself in everything the people in the school do every day. It determines the tone of environment for learning and growing. Our Yangzheng school culture focuses on the culture of care_ culture of learning and the culture of excellence:  Culture of Care emphasises on the need to be inclusive. Care is extended to everyone (Pupils_ Staff and Stakeholders) and no one is left out. Yangzheng Primary is just like a second home where positive relationships are developed_ nurtured and maintained. The school environment is one that is caring and nurturing.   Culture of Learning focuses on the need to be life-long learners and to stay relevant in the society. At Yangzheng Primary_ pupils are exposed to a vibrant and engaging learning environment to cater to the different learning needs.  Culture of Excellence encourages every Yangzhengnite to put in his/her finest effort. Everyone is guided by the school values (Passion for Learning_ Responsibility_ Integrity_ Self-Discipline and Emphathy) to give his/her best in every endeavour.
special_sdp_offered: The school builds a strong foundation in our pupils through its programmes that hinge on Joy of Learning and Continual Improvement.  -To better engage pupils in their cognitive development_ the school has designed Authentic Learning Experiences to meet their needs_ interests and abilities. These include Fun Learning Programmes in all subjects such as Inquiry-Based Science lessons and customised trails.  - Developing Oracy Skills and Teaching Physical Science and Math Concepts Through Building Blocks. "YZPS Legoland" focuses on using building blocks to instil fun in learning the English Language_ with alignment to STELLAR. Drama strategies were infused to provide a platform for teachers and pupils to generate_ select and organise ideas for speaking and writing.  The school also uses building blocks in the teaching of physical Science and Math to provide pupils with experiential learning experiences for better understanding of concepts.  - We believe that Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) Programmes is the key in shaping our pupils holistically. CCE is integrated into our curricular and co-curricular programmes to better engage pupils in values learning. It includes Values in Action Programme and our school's Learning for Life Programme - Leadership and Life Skills through Uniformed Groups where pupils are developed in character_ lifeskills and leadership.   - E3 (Explore_ Engage and Experience) Day is a whole school approach on customised learning journeys (LJ) that aim to promote experiential learning through fun and meaningful activities.  Mobile learning is incorporated to develop Self-directed Learning and Collaborative Learning Skills in pupils. Performance Tasks through Social Studies serves as an extension to the pupils' learning acquired at the LJ.   - The school promotes a whole-school approach to Healthy Living. Fun Friday mass exercise and FruiTime that aims to encourage pupils to eat fruits as part of their daily diet are organised.

bus_desc: SBS 99 (From Clementi Inter-change) SBS 241 (From Boon Lay Inter-change)
visionstatement_desc: A Bright Student  A Talented Person A Useful Citizen
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing holistic and morally upright individuals to pursue excellence and rise to the challenges of the future
philosophy_culture_ethos: Touching Hearts_ Engaging Minds Providing a quality education that develops our pupils holistically has always been the mission of Juying Primary School. We firmly believe that every child can learn and wants to learn. We touch hearts and engage minds.   Besides providing a strong support for learning_ Juying Primary stretches every child's potential by catering to the varied needs and interests of our pupils through a suite of well-designed and innovative programmes. Over the years_ our pupils have consistently performed well in the academic and non-academic domains_ garnering numerous awards at the Olympiads and accolades in the aesthetics and physical domains. Their success is due to the commitment of our caring teachers_ hard work put in by the pupils_ and strong support from the parents and stakeholders.  Caring Teachers_ Aspiring Learners Juying Primary has dedicated teachers who go the extra mile to show care and concern to their pupils. Immersed in the school's caring culture_ our teachers build strong teacher-student relationships through which they motivate and encourage their pupils to be the best that they can be. A community of professionals_ our teachers continuously deepen their expertise_ taking pride in their work and profession. As they continue to learn_ they pass on the love of learning to their pupils. Reaching out to every child_ our teachers lead_ care and inspire.   Nurturing a Growth Mindset_ Developing Grit  In Juying_ we are very keen to provide our students with the opportunities they need to develop a Growth Mindset during the critical and formative period of their lives. Backed by more than thirty years of scientific investigation_ the school partners parents in cultivating a growth mindset in our charges so that they will be inspired to always put in their best effort_ embrace challenges and never give up. Juying Primary is known to produce resilient pupils with grit.
special_sdp_offered: Nurturing Curiosity_ Instilling Empathy for the environment To this end_ the school has established a cohesive pedagogical framework to environmental inquiry. The six year Environmental Integrated Project Work (EIP) programme allows pupils to integrate knowledge from various disciplines_ and unpack environmental topics in engaging and experiential approaches. Through the environmental inquiry and other green efforts_ we nurture a sense of wonder in our pupils and instil in them an abiding sense of care for their environment. For the school's active contribution to the environment_ the school is conferred the pinnacle awards by Singapore Environmental Council.   Leveraging Technology_ Empowering Learners Juying Primary believes that technology-enriched pedagogical practices will bring about deep learning and develop critical 21st Century Competencies in our pupils in preparing them for the future. As the school's signature pedagogy_ the Flipped Team-Based Learning instructional programme provides opportunities for pupils to engage in higher-order thinking activities_ and develop essential soft skills such as self-directed learning and collaborative learning.   With funding and support by EduLab_ the school partners the NIE in this curriculum innovation and leverages on ICT to empower learning.   Nurturing Talent_ Cultivating Appreciation Juying Primary is also committed to providing a quality Arts education that nurtures pupils' aesthetic talents and develops their enjoyment and appreciation for the Arts. This is achieved through the 4Es: Exposure and Experience for all_ Engagement for the interested & Excellence-building for the talented. The Art and Music specialised teachers provide pupils with authentic learning experiences that ignite the joy of learning. In their six years_ pupils have the opportunity to learn various instruments and are exposed to various art forms.

visionstatement_desc: Future-Ready Learners_ Leaders of Character
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Every Child in a Vibrant and Caring Environment where Talents Blossom
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Junyuan Primary School (JYPS)_ we believe that every child is special_ valuable and important. We seek to equip our students with the necessary knowledge_ values and skills that will prepare them adequately to face the challenges of the future.   The school has identified five distinct strands of outcomes known as the Desired Junyuan Outcomes (DJOs) that each student should achieve through three defined key stages by the end of P6. They are Self-Directed Learners_ Adaptable Individuals_ Critical Thinkers_ Confident Communicators and Concerned Citizens.   These outcomes were identified based on the school's philosophy of preparing our students for the future and to mould them as leaders of character.   The school seeks to develop students who are grounded in values and are concerned citizens who can contribute positively to the school_ home and community. The acronym EnR3ICH outlines the 7 JYPS school values: ExcelleNce_ Respect_ Responsibility_ Resilience_ Integrity_ Care_ Harmony.  The 7 values are introduced during our assembly programmes_ Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) Lessons and reinforced through our school-based programmes. They provide a guide for our students to be able to distinguish right from wrong_ help them make responsible choices_ foster positive relationships with their peers and others_ be able to display leadership qualities in the areas of leading self and leading others_ as well as help them become more aware of their roles in school_ the community and Singapore.   The school motto 'Work to Excel' embodies the spirit in JYPS where our students are self-directed in learning and seek opportunities for progress and innovation. They will be confident in their communication and develop a critical mind for thinking. He/She will be adaptable to take on new roles readily and demonstrate resilience in the face of challenges.
special_sdp_offered: Applied Learning Programme : DEVELOPING EVERY STUDENT INTO A CONFIDENT COMMUNICATOR  The school seeks to equip our students with skills and dispositions to prepare them for the 21st century in the area of confident communication. Every JYPS student will experience the 6-year Confident Communicator programme aimed at developing their confidence in speaking and communicating with others. The inter-departmental   collaboration amongst the EL_ MTL and ICT departments has resulted in myriad programmes and meaningful activities which are weaved into the curriculum progressively through the levels.   Authentic settings are designed to provide our students with opportunities to discuss ideas and share their observations with peers and teachers. Leveraging technology_ students record their performances in Junyuan's broadcasting studio - Studio 91 and take turns to participate in the weekly broadcast where they speak on a topic of their choice related to the school values_ events or current affairs.   Learning for Life Programme : SHAPING INDIVIDUALS TO EXCEL (SHINE) @ JUNYUAN THROUGH SPORTS  SHINE aims to develop critical thinkers who are self-directed_ adaptable and strive towards personal excellence. It aims to foster a school culture that embraces sports and strengthen the character and resilience of the students through an active lifestyle for life-long learning.  Tchoukball has been identified as one of the key programmes for its versatility as a sport.
